Client Processing - S5 Applies expertise and judgement in providing quality, and complex client service and support to internal and external clients on a daily basis, including phone interaction, problem resolution, transaction processing (i.e., STP, manual), reconciliations and accounting services, and updates to client accounts in a timely manner. Performs complex operational tasks in a product or functional area. Conducts independent analysis and policy interpretation. Performs complex, manual processing of updates to client accounts or company records. Responsible for reconciliations, including reconciling cash breaks, position differences, and gathering and compiling data. Serves as the primary point of contact for clients and executes all correspondent requisites in a timely and accurate manner with an understanding of the underlying business and specific client needs. Maintains correspondent accounts in accordance with applicable regulations and policies, ensuring regulatory compliance and minimizing exposure related to assigned processing tasks. Identifies, investigates and resolves problems in client accounts or company records. Works closely with technology and systems teams to ensure the system is efficient and incorporates any necessary risk mitigations. Provides product knowledge and technical assistance, determining when the more complex problems should be referred to a supervisor or senior professional. Review and check work of other Client Processing Support staff and help resolve escalated issues. May be responsible for allocating and checking work of other team members. May be responsible for specific supervisory review and approval actions. Responsible for the quality and completion of own work.

The Fund Accounting Department is responsible for ensuring the timely and accurate preparation of daily net asset values (NAVs)for a number of complex funds investing in a wide variety of instrument types including equities, fixed and variable bonds, derivatives and emerging markets.
 
The Senior Analyst is primarily responsible for ensuring the timely and accurate completion of all funds within the team. He/she is responsible for checking all work completed by fund accountants I and II on the team and ensuring that all procedures and controls are being complied with. In addition he/she is responsible for the overall work allocation of the team.

Responsibilities:
 
•Ensure the team valuations are prepared to meet daily deadlines
•Ensure the team daily prices are issued to all relevant parties in accordance with daily requirements.
•Assume responsibility for the team's operational meetings.
•Liaise with custodians to resolve any reconciliation issues
•Check fee schedules on a timely basis.
•Liaise with investment managers to ensure efficient flow of information.
•Liaise with external clients, investment managers, custodians and auditors.
•Ensure timely completion of statutory returns and ad-hoc requests.
 
Tone from the Top -Work collaboratively and on a timely basis with managers to review operational controls, conduct root-cause analysis and implement remediation activities emanating from operating incidents and near-miss events.

Risk Competence &Knowledge - Understand the key operational risks and the associated controls applicable to the Business Unit and follow all Business Unit operational procedures and other directive controls (eg. checklists) as designed. 
 
Any identified issues or changes should be escalated to Managers.
 
Accountability -.Ensure that risk issues (both current and emerging) are escalated promptly to managers, including:
 
Gaps or issues identified within the Business Unit controls;
 
Errors or potential errors/near-misses;
 
Other risk issues (including non-responses to queries, manual process intervention).

 

 

  Qualifications Requirements: 
 
•Third level qualification in business related discipline.
•Self-motivation and the ability to work independently and as part of a team.
•Communication skills.
•PC literacy.
•Organisational and planning skills.
•At least 3 years work experience within a similar environment
•Supervisory experience.

The Lead Manager, Fund/Client Accounting will be assigned to a specific set of funds and clients along with a small number of other junior accounting staff to service PE/RE clients. The role will serve as primary day to day contact for daily service to PE/RE clients on a specific sub set of funds. The PE/RE Specialist I will provide premier client service and is responsible for the production of weekly/monthly/quarterly reporting to PE/RE clients. The incumbent will serve as the first escalation point for problem resolution and will escalate to the team manager as and when appropriate. The incumbent will be repsonsible for ensuring a strong control environment is maintained at all times including strict adherence to Global PE/RE procedures and controls. 

Responsible for primary day to day contact for specific PE/RE clients and funds. Actively contribute to the production of PE/RE Operations client reporting. 
Ensures prompt escalation of potential client issues and contribute to developing solutions that meet client requirements. 
Ensure that PE/RE client deliverables are produced accurately and in compliance with policy within expected timeframe agreed in client service level documents. 
Promptly ensures any service delivery issues are escalated to the Team Manager. Actively contributes to the preparation of client KPI, MIS and report cards.

Responsible for ensuring that NAV packs for PE/RE clients are prepared in line with company policy and procedure.
Assists Team Manager with resolution of any queries from Internal Control, Internal Audit, Trustee, SSAE 16 or external audit reviews.
The incumbent requires problem solving skills necessary to solve various accounting issues that arise on a daily basis that affect clients and their accounts.
S/he will act as the first escalation point for problem resolution and will assist more junior team members to solution problems they encounter in their day to day work.
This role involves daily interactions with clients and internal departments within AIS, it requires the individual to provide service delivery to internal and external clients that is both accurate and efficient.  Qualifications 
The job holder will have a degree in accounting, business or other qualifications relevant to the investment industry and in particular PE/RE. 
Detailed working knowledge of the alternatives industry and of the different areas within service delivery. 
The individual should aggressively look to grow their knowledge and expertise in the PE/RE area. 
The encumbent will serve as a subject matter expert for more junior staff. 
Excellent interpersonal skills, ability to communicate effectively, both verbally and in written form is critical to this role.
7+ years Financial Services experience

column2: Sr. Group Manager, Third Party Governance (TPG) - Policy Program Governance Lead
column4:
The Third Party Governance (TPG) - Policy Program Governance Lead manages the program framework and associated evergreen governance process. The Lead would be the resident expert about the Third Party Risk and needs to build strong relationships with other first, second, and third lines of defenses in US and worldwide. The job is a highly visible role and the Lead will need to work closely with senior executives. 

Primary Responsibilities Include: 
   1. Creating the Regulatory Repository:
         a. The Lead is responsible for building a repository of guidance from all State, Federal, and international regulators that impact the Bank Third Party Governance program
         b. The Lead is responsible for creating a gap analysis to determine the differences among guidance from various regulators 
         c. The Lead needs to work with Legal, Compliance, and other teams to ensure that there is no redundancy of work being done among teams
   2. Creating the TPG Policies:
         a. The Lead is responsible creating the TPG policies that comply with guidance from regulators
         b. The Lead needs to create a traceability matrix at granular level that tracks the Policies to individual sections in guidance from regulators
   3. Helping with Controls:
         a. The Lead needs to participate and provide feedback during process design, inherent risk assessment, and creation of the compensating controls during the RCSA creation 
         b. The Lead should be available as the Policy subject matter expert to the Controls and other teams
   4. Creating and Managing the Evergreen Regulatory Compliant Policy Program
         a. The Lead needs to work with Legal, Compliance, and other teams to create and manage an ongoing evergreen regulatory compliant policy program. 
         b. The Lead is expected to obtain the regulatory changes from Legal/Compliance and determine what needs to change within TPG policies and execute on those changes.
   5. Helping with Regulatory Responses and Meetings
         a. The Lead is expected to help with all TPG regulatory meetings and regulatory responses.

Ideal candidate will be an ambitious, energetic, go-getter, who welcomes challenges and views this role as a proving ground for bigger opportunities.

The desired candidate will work as a business analyst and project manager, supporting the Treasury Cash Management and Liquidity areas, in the Corporate Treasury Technology team.  The Corporate Treasury Technology team supports BNY Mellon’s fixed income and securities finance portfolio, which is a significant portion of the firm’s overall balance sheet.  The candidate will liaise with various business groups including corporate treasury front, middle and back office teams as well as various risk and enterprise technology systems in BNY Mellon.  The business analyst project manager primary objective is to design and implement technology solutions cost-effectively for projects or a program on time and within budget.  Perform all the end to end project management activities such as project reporting, project planning, issue / risk identification and tracking, scope management, estimation, client management, relationship management and other project documentation preparation for projects of high business complexity (involving multiple systems interfaces that are highly visible to the organization).  Serves as a liaison between clients and internal technology groups and secures, leads, motivates and inspires the internal & external resources required to deliver the program.             
 Responsibilities include: 


 Coordinate with the various business and technology teams to drive several key projects for critical business and regulatory initiatives in Corporate Treasury 

 Groom user stories with the team and manage all user stories into sprints. 

 Work with cross functional teams to obtain agreements all business and technology groups. 

 Creates and reviews artifacts and workflow diagrams for projects of high business complexity (involving multiple systems interfaces that are highly visible to the organization).   

 Analyze complex data issues and work with developers to create a design utilizing the latest technologies. 

 Advisor to developers and providing sound judgements in a wide variety of business and technical issues. 

 Lead, execute, and coordinate the development of multiple critical tasks, often in parallel, and work directly with all stakeholders. 

 Adhere to BNY Mellon’s DLC process as well as manage issues and risks to closure. 

 Analyze complex data issues and work with developers to create a design utilizing the latest technologies. 

 Document clear data mapping to data sources as well as creating formulas for required calculations to communicate  
 The candidate will have the following experience, knowledge, and skills (12+ years):  


 Computer Science degree or equivalent experience 

 Understanding of global payments and systems to settle financial transactions 

 Experience supporting a fixed income trading desk 

 Experience in managing small enhancements and projects  

 Experience in current and future state workflow diagrams 

 Experience in data analysis across multiple systems 

 Experience with various Agile and SDLC processes and methodologies as well as authoring the SDLC artifacts  

 Experience as Scrum Master or Product Owner 

 Experience as a Project manager 

 Understanding of C#, .Net, SQL, XML, SWIFT, FTP, messaging and reporting tools 

 Outstanding analytical skills so business needs are translated into functional and technical requirements. 

 Leadership skills  

 Program management skills

Project Management Professional (PMP) certification is beneficial 10 - 12 years of related project management experience required, experience with technology or financial services industry is a plus. Client Processing - S5 Applies expertise and judgement in providing quality, and complex client service and support to internal and external clients on a daily basis, including phone interaction, problem resolution, transaction processing (i.e., STP, manual), reconciliations and accounting services, and updates to client accounts in a timely manner. Performs complex operational tasks in a product or functional area. Conducts independent analysis and policy interpretation. Performs complex, manual processing of updates to client accounts or company records. Responsible for reconciliations, including reconciling cash breaks, position differences, and gathering and compiling data. Serves as the primary point of contact for clients and executes all correspondent requisites in a timely and accurate manner with an understanding of the underlying business and specific client needs. Maintains correspondent accounts in accordance with applicable regulations and policies, ensuring regulatory compliance and minimizing exposure related to assigned processing tasks. Identifies, investigates and resolves problems in client accounts or company records. Works closely with technology and systems teams to ensure the system is efficient and incorporates any necessary risk mitigations. Provides product knowledge and technical assistance, determining when the more complex problems should be referred to a supervisor or senior professional. Review and check work of other Client Processing Support staff and help resolve escalated issues. May be responsible for allocating and checking work of other team members. May be responsible for specific supervisory review and approval actions. Responsible for the quality and completion of own work.

The Fund Accounting Department is responsible for ensuring the timely and accurate preparation of daily net asset values (NAVs)for a number of complex funds investing in a wide variety of instrument types including equities, fixed and variable bonds, derivatives and emerging markets.
 
The Senior Analyst is primarily responsible for ensuring the timely and accurate completion of all funds within the team. He/she is responsible for checking all work completed by fund accountants I and II on the team and ensuring that all procedures and controls are being complied with. In addition he/she is responsible for the overall work allocation of the team.

Responsibilities:
 
•Ensure the team valuations are prepared to meet daily deadlines
•Ensure the team daily prices are issued to all relevant parties in accordance with daily requirements.
•Assume responsibility for the team's operational meetings.
•Liaise with custodians to resolve any reconciliation issues
•Check fee schedules on a timely basis.
•Liaise with investment managers to ensure efficient flow of information.
•Liaise with external clients, investment managers, custodians and auditors.
•Ensure timely completion of statutory returns and ad-hoc requests.
 
Tone from the Top -Work collaboratively and on a timely basis with managers to review operational controls, conduct root-cause analysis and implement remediation activities emanating from operating incidents and near-miss events.

Risk Competence &Knowledge - Understand the key operational risks and the associated controls applicable to the Business Unit and follow all Business Unit operational procedures and other directive controls (eg. checklists) as designed. 
 
Any identified issues or changes should be escalated to Managers.
 
Accountability -.Ensure that risk issues (both current and emerging) are escalated promptly to managers, including:
 
Gaps or issues identified within the Business Unit controls;
 
Errors or potential errors/near-misses;
 
Other risk issues (including non-responses to queries, manual process intervention).

 

 

  Qualifications Requirements: 
 
•Third level qualification in business related discipline.
•Self-motivation and the ability to work independently and as part of a team.
•Communication skills.
•PC literacy.
•Organisational and planning skills.
•At least 3 years work experience within a similar environment
•Supervisory experience.

The desired candidate will work as a business analyst and project manager, supporting the Treasury Cash Management and Liquidity areas, in the Corporate Treasury Technology team.  The Corporate Treasury Technology team supports BNY Mellon’s fixed income and securities finance portfolio, which is a significant portion of the firm’s overall balance sheet.  The candidate will liaise with various business groups including corporate treasury front, middle and back office teams as well as various risk and enterprise technology systems in BNY Mellon.  The business analyst project manager primary objective is to design and implement technology solutions cost-effectively for projects or a program on time and within budget.  Perform all the end to end project management activities such as project reporting, project planning, issue / risk identification and tracking, scope management, estimation, client management, relationship management and other project documentation preparation for projects of high business complexity (involving multiple systems interfaces that are highly visible to the organization).  Serves as a liaison between clients and internal technology groups and secures, leads, motivates and inspires the internal & external resources required to deliver the program.             
 Responsibilities include: 


 Coordinate with the various business and technology teams to drive several key projects for critical business and regulatory initiatives in Corporate Treasury 

 Groom user stories with the team and manage all user stories into sprints. 

 Work with cross functional teams to obtain agreements all business and technology groups. 

 Creates and reviews artifacts and workflow diagrams for projects of high business complexity (involving multiple systems interfaces that are highly visible to the organization).   

 Analyze complex data issues and work with developers to create a design utilizing the latest technologies. 

 Advisor to developers and providing sound judgements in a wide variety of business and technical issues. 

 Lead, execute, and coordinate the development of multiple critical tasks, often in parallel, and work directly with all stakeholders. 

 Adhere to BNY Mellon’s DLC process as well as manage issues and risks to closure. 

 Analyze complex data issues and work with developers to create a design utilizing the latest technologies. 

 Document clear data mapping to data sources as well as creating formulas for required calculations to communicate  
 The candidate will have the following experience, knowledge, and skills (12+ years):  


 Computer Science degree or equivalent experience 

 Understanding of global payments and systems to settle financial transactions 

 Experience supporting a fixed income trading desk 

 Experience in managing small enhancements and projects  

 Experience in current and future state workflow diagrams 

 Experience in data analysis across multiple systems 

 Experience with various Agile and SDLC processes and methodologies as well as authoring the SDLC artifacts  

 Experience as Scrum Master or Product Owner 

 Experience as a Project manager 

 Understanding of C#, .Net, SQL, XML, SWIFT, FTP, messaging and reporting tools 

 Outstanding analytical skills so business needs are translated into functional and technical requirements. 

 Leadership skills  

 Program management skills

An Administrative Officer at the Vice President level in the Operations & Shared Services Technology group. The role reports into the Chief Administrative Officer (CAO) for Operations & Shared Services Technology (O&SST), and is part of the CAO team, supporting the Chief Information Officer of O&SST. The role of the Administrative Officer is to support the day-to-day running of the organization in terms of its headcount, budgets, strategy, reporting and communication to enable better decision making at the senior leadership team level.
 
Key Responsibilities
·         Program & Project Management
o   Responsibility for administrative duties in conjunction with the team, which include but are not limited to PowerPoint composition, analytics computation, addressing requests for information, and general coordination.
o   Help the CAO team to combine technology vision and business objectives into program plans and presentations that deliver value.
 
·         Financial Management
o   Assist team leadership in formulating budget proposals based on current and anticipated growth, market conditions, strategic direction, etc. 
o   Understand the complexities of accruals, allocations, impact of capitalization, recovery, and fixed price expense in order to support strategy.
o   Support timely and accurate periodic and ad hoc financial reporting.
 
·         Workforce Management
o   Activities including headcount management, organizational chart updates, vendor and contractor management oversite support, and location strategy support — seating/space allocation.
 
·         Communications & Events
o   Events including, town halls, guest speaker, learning, code-a-thons, showcases, etc.
o   Internal team communications including emails, newsletters, Hamilton, SharePoint, Confluence, etc.
o   External team communications includes maintenance of our MySource Social content, and other content available on the corporate intranet.
 Qualifications
Key Qualifications
·         Experience in technology, finance, and/or operations is preferred.
·         Demonstrated ability to work in a team of diverse skill sets and cultures — integrity, maturity, dependability, and a positive professional attitude.
·         Strong interpersonal skills including facilitation, teaming, presentation, and communications (both oral and written) — consultative, collaborative approach to engaging others and delivering value.
·         Highly self-motivated, proactive, responsive, and organized — able to quickly prioritize, respond to, and act on requests.
·         Proficient in PowerPoint for management presentations — ability to conduct research, perform analysis, organize findings, and compile compelling rational business narratives.
·         Expert in Excel, specifically pivots, v-lookups, macros, management of large data sets, etc.
·         Experience with web, SharePoint, or Confluence site design and content management, a plus.
 Bachelor's degree in business information/systems/industrial engineering or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required, MBA preferred, 8-10 years of experience in broad-based information technology required, at least 3 years of experience in systems management and cost-effective budgetary responsibility, experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus. Job Purpose:

To service, market and generate sales from a sophisticated wholesale-institutional (70/30 %) client base in the Netherlands, including wholesale and private banks, wealth offices, fiduciary managers, pension funds and insurance companies
To work, as a team, together with the Country Head to realise further, high-quality, sustainable revenue 
To service the existing client base in a pro-active and client centric manner
To create a true partnership with the opt-in investment boutiques
To raise the profile of BNY Mellon Investment Management EMEA Ltd in The Netherlands as an asset management company.
Company Overview:
 
BNY Mellon Investment Management’s goal is to build and manage investment and wealth management strategies and solutions that address the ever-changing needs of our clients. Drawing on deep expertise, we collaborate with our clients to understand their needs and tailor our best ideas and resources to meet their specific requirements. As recognised pioneers of the multi-boutique model, BNY Mellon have some of the best investment ideas, from the finest investment minds, all in one place. 
 
BNY Mellon Investment Management has over US$1.9 trillion AUM (as at 31 March 2018) and is the global investment management arm of BNY Mellon, one of the world’s largest global asset managers We provide investment management, investment services and wealth management that help institutions and individuals succeed in markets all over the world.
 
Key Responsibilities:
 


On a senior level and in a solutions driven approach, pro-actively service existing contacts/ prospects/ clients in the Dutch market including wholesale and private banks, wealth offices, fiduciary managers, pension funds and insurance companies

Covering the client base in a client centric and mindful manner  

Excellent knowledge of the investment boutiques and their services

Organising and attending road shows in order to raise the BNY Mellon and investment boutique profile in The Netherlands and to increase business opportunities.

Organising and attending prospect meetings.

Attending the relevant sales conferences.

Increase business opportunities, number of RFP’s etc.

Close new business deals working with clients, investment boutiques, product specialists/fund managers, legal.

Take responsibility for agreed revenue and cost budget.
  Qualifications Job Specific Competencies 


Establishing solid client relationships-connect

Building and leveraging internal relationships

Client knowledge and understanding.

Solving problems and creating solutions.

Executing the sales process.

Demonstrating our shared values with clients and co-workers.

Apply IM EMEA standards of ‘Treating Customers Fairly’ in all client dealings.

Fluent written and spoken, Dutch and English.
Technical Skills, Knowledge, Systems Knowledge (and associated skill level):


Thorough knowledge of BNY Mellon’s asset management products.

Thorough knowledge of asset management industry.
Academic/Professional Qualifications/ Experience:


Graduated Bachelor/ Master degree from University or equivalent.

CFA or equivalent.

Significant relevant experience.

Job Purpose:
 
This database engineering role is an opportunity to significantly contribute to the design and delivery of Newton’s data pipelines across multiple database platforms.
 
This hand on technical role will require the candidate to understand Newton’s database estate and how it is consumed by different groups across the business. This will involve working with business teams to understand their data needs, in addition to working with various development teams to deliver the data.
This is a great role for an experienced database developer / engineer who enjoys a level of business user interaction and enjoys being a data subject matter expert.
 
Company Overview:
 
Newton Investment Management Limited is an active investment management firm, using thematic ideas about the long-term investment landscape to create and manage strategies that help secure clients’ futures. Newton thinks on a global basis, with its single London-based investment team working collaboratively across asset classes and regions. The firm builds bold solutions, designed to meet the real-world challenges clients face, and the team manage them responsibly in the broadest sense – through embedding environmental, social and governance considerations, and engaging on issues that affect their clients. Those clients are based around the world, and include pension funds, corporations and charities and, via Newton’s parent company BNY Mellon, individuals. 
 
With offices in London and New York, Newton has £49.8bn assets under management  (as at 31 March 2018), including assets managed by Newton Investment Management Limited as dual officers of Newton Investment Management (North America) Limited and The Bank of New York Mellon. News and other information about Newton is available at www.newtonim.com and via Twitter: @NewtonIM.
 
Key Responsibilities:


Hands on responsibility for data engineering of relational databases (Oracle and Microsoft SQL server).

Ensure the smooth running of all processes that use or derive data from data feeds.

Development and maintenance of existing and future data pipelines.

Analysis and solution construction for adhoc business data enquiries.

Provide impact analysis of data change across multiple systems. 

Contributing to the development of analytics capabilities across the company.

Making improvements to the build and deployment mechanisms for database changes.
  Qualifications Job Specific Competencies; 
 
Technical Skills/Systems Knowledge (and associated skill level):

Extensive experience in relational database development, particularly Oracle and MS SQL server
Experience of writing and optimising stored procedures and views to transform and deliver data
Experience using performance, monitoring and alerting tools
Experience in scripting/automation language (Shell, Python)
Familiar with ETL processes
Interest in NoSQL database, and BigData concepts and systems
Preferred by non-essential Technical Skills/Systems Knowledge:

Any experience with SAP Business Objects would be a plus.
Any experience with Markit EDM would be a plus.
Academic/Professional Qualifications (or equivalent qualifiers):


Formal education in Computer Science, Engineering or related discipline preferred.
People (team-working/collaboration skills):

Good communicator and collaborator keen to work closely across teams and the business.
Knowledge of SCRUM or other Agile methodologies.
Self (integrity and the ability to reflect confidence):

Exceptional problem solving skills and intellectual curiosity.
Passion for innovation and creative problem solving with an enthusiasm to evangelise to others.
 
Results (the ability to be proactive and take action):

Get hands-on, providing technical direction and/or problem solving to support the team.
Ensure all third-party development conforms to organisation best-practice and quality standards.

An Administrative Officer at the Vice President level in the Operations & Shared Services Technology group. The role reports into the Chief Administrative Officer (CAO) for Operations & Shared Services Technology (O&SST), and is part of the CAO team, supporting the Chief Information Officer of O&SST. The role of the Administrative Officer is to support the day-to-day running of the organization in terms of its headcount, budgets, strategy, reporting and communication to enable better decision making at the senior leadership team level.
 
Key Responsibilities
·         Program & Project Management
o   Responsibility for administrative duties in conjunction with the team, which include but are not limited to PowerPoint composition, analytics computation, addressing requests for information, and general coordination.
o   Help the CAO team to combine technology vision and business objectives into program plans and presentations that deliver value.
 
·         Financial Management
o   Assist team leadership in formulating budget proposals based on current and anticipated growth, market conditions, strategic direction, etc. 
o   Understand the complexities of accruals, allocations, impact of capitalization, recovery, and fixed price expense in order to support strategy.
o   Support timely and accurate periodic and ad hoc financial reporting.
 
·         Workforce Management
o   Activities including headcount management, organizational chart updates, vendor and contractor management oversite support, and location strategy support — seating/space allocation.
 
·         Communications & Events
o   Events including, town halls, guest speaker, learning, code-a-thons, showcases, etc.
o   Internal team communications including emails, newsletters, Hamilton, SharePoint, Confluence, etc.
o   External team communications includes maintenance of our MySource Social content, and other content available on the corporate intranet.
 Qualifications
Key Qualifications
·         Experience in technology, finance, and/or operations is preferred.
·         Demonstrated ability to work in a team of diverse skill sets and cultures — integrity, maturity, dependability, and a positive professional attitude.
·         Strong interpersonal skills including facilitation, teaming, presentation, and communications (both oral and written) — consultative, collaborative approach to engaging others and delivering value.
·         Highly self-motivated, proactive, responsive, and organized — able to quickly prioritize, respond to, and act on requests.
·         Proficient in PowerPoint for management presentations — ability to conduct research, perform analysis, organize findings, and compile compelling rational business narratives.
·         Expert in Excel, specifically pivots, v-lookups, macros, management of large data sets, etc.
·         Experience with web, SharePoint, or Confluence site design and content management, a plus.
 Bachelor's degree in business information/systems/industrial engineering or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required, MBA preferred, 8-10 years of experience in broad-based information technology required, at least 3 years of experience in systems management and cost-effective budgetary responsibility, experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus. Job Purpose:

To service, market and generate sales from a sophisticated wholesale-institutional (70/30 %) client base in the Netherlands, including wholesale and private banks, wealth offices, fiduciary managers, pension funds and insurance companies
To work, as a team, together with the Country Head to realise further, high-quality, sustainable revenue 
To service the existing client base in a pro-active and client centric manner
To create a true partnership with the opt-in investment boutiques
To raise the profile of BNY Mellon Investment Management EMEA Ltd in The Netherlands as an asset management company.
Company Overview:
 
BNY Mellon Investment Management’s goal is to build and manage investment and wealth management strategies and solutions that address the ever-changing needs of our clients. Drawing on deep expertise, we collaborate with our clients to understand their needs and tailor our best ideas and resources to meet their specific requirements. As recognised pioneers of the multi-boutique model, BNY Mellon have some of the best investment ideas, from the finest investment minds, all in one place. 
 
BNY Mellon Investment Management has over US$1.9 trillion AUM (as at 31 March 2018) and is the global investment management arm of BNY Mellon, one of the world’s largest global asset managers We provide investment management, investment services and wealth management that help institutions and individuals succeed in markets all over the world.
 
Key Responsibilities:
 


On a senior level and in a solutions driven approach, pro-actively service existing contacts/ prospects/ clients in the Dutch market including wholesale and private banks, wealth offices, fiduciary managers, pension funds and insurance companies

Covering the client base in a client centric and mindful manner  

Excellent knowledge of the investment boutiques and their services

Organising and attending road shows in order to raise the BNY Mellon and investment boutique profile in The Netherlands and to increase business opportunities.

Organising and attending prospect meetings.

Attending the relevant sales conferences.

Increase business opportunities, number of RFP’s etc.

Close new business deals working with clients, investment boutiques, product specialists/fund managers, legal.

Take responsibility for agreed revenue and cost budget.
  Qualifications Job Specific Competencies 


Establishing solid client relationships-connect

Building and leveraging internal relationships

Client knowledge and understanding.

Solving problems and creating solutions.

Executing the sales process.

Demonstrating our shared values with clients and co-workers.

Apply IM EMEA standards of ‘Treating Customers Fairly’ in all client dealings.

Fluent written and spoken, Dutch and English.
Technical Skills, Knowledge, Systems Knowledge (and associated skill level):


Thorough knowledge of BNY Mellon’s asset management products.

Thorough knowledge of asset management industry.
Academic/Professional Qualifications/ Experience:


Graduated Bachelor/ Master degree from University or equivalent.

CFA or equivalent.

Significant relevant experience.

Job Purpose:
 
This database engineering role is an opportunity to significantly contribute to the design and delivery of Newton’s data pipelines across multiple database platforms.
 
This hand on technical role will require the candidate to understand Newton’s database estate and how it is consumed by different groups across the business. This will involve working with business teams to understand their data needs, in addition to working with various development teams to deliver the data.
This is a great role for an experienced database developer / engineer who enjoys a level of business user interaction and enjoys being a data subject matter expert.
 
Company Overview:
 
Newton Investment Management Limited is an active investment management firm, using thematic ideas about the long-term investment landscape to create and manage strategies that help secure clients’ futures. Newton thinks on a global basis, with its single London-based investment team working collaboratively across asset classes and regions. The firm builds bold solutions, designed to meet the real-world challenges clients face, and the team manage them responsibly in the broadest sense – through embedding environmental, social and governance considerations, and engaging on issues that affect their clients. Those clients are based around the world, and include pension funds, corporations and charities and, via Newton’s parent company BNY Mellon, individuals. 
 
With offices in London and New York, Newton has £49.8bn assets under management  (as at 31 March 2018), including assets managed by Newton Investment Management Limited as dual officers of Newton Investment Management (North America) Limited and The Bank of New York Mellon. News and other information about Newton is available at www.newtonim.com and via Twitter: @NewtonIM.
 
Key Responsibilities:


Hands on responsibility for data engineering of relational databases (Oracle and Microsoft SQL server).

Ensure the smooth running of all processes that use or derive data from data feeds.

Development and maintenance of existing and future data pipelines.

Analysis and solution construction for adhoc business data enquiries.

Provide impact analysis of data change across multiple systems. 

Contributing to the development of analytics capabilities across the company.

Making improvements to the build and deployment mechanisms for database changes.
  Qualifications Job Specific Competencies; 
 
Technical Skills/Systems Knowledge (and associated skill level):

Extensive experience in relational database development, particularly Oracle and MS SQL server
Experience of writing and optimising stored procedures and views to transform and deliver data
Experience using performance, monitoring and alerting tools
Experience in scripting/automation language (Shell, Python)
Familiar with ETL processes
Interest in NoSQL database, and BigData concepts and systems
Preferred by non-essential Technical Skills/Systems Knowledge:

Any experience with SAP Business Objects would be a plus.
Any experience with Markit EDM would be a plus.
Academic/Professional Qualifications (or equivalent qualifiers):


Formal education in Computer Science, Engineering or related discipline preferred.
People (team-working/collaboration skills):

Good communicator and collaborator keen to work closely across teams and the business.
Knowledge of SCRUM or other Agile methodologies.
Self (integrity and the ability to reflect confidence):

Exceptional problem solving skills and intellectual curiosity.
Passion for innovation and creative problem solving with an enthusiasm to evangelise to others.
 
Results (the ability to be proactive and take action):

Get hands-on, providing technical direction and/or problem solving to support the team.
Ensure all third-party development conforms to organisation best-practice and quality standards.
#LI-DB2 BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer.  Primary Location: United Kingdom-Greater London-London Job: Asset Management Internal Jobcode: 51575 Organization: Newton-HR06148 Requisition Number: 1815761

Additionally, is responsible for understanding trends in the industry and making policy recommendations. This position requires knowledge of the Financial Services Industry regulations, compliance, operations or auditing. Contributes to the achievement of team objectives. Supports moderately complex projects and provides insight on interpretation of regulations. Cross-functional Relationship Management and Business Development 
 
Responsibilities:

Independently manages a portfolio of existing clients or prospects, focusing on client satisfaction, relationship building and responsible business growth that is compliant, of acceptable risk and profitable. 
Serves in a consultative role to clients and prospects, advising top leadership on the best way to achieve their short- and long- term strategic objectives through the firms solutions. 
Assists small to moderate emerging institutional prospects or clients with high-growth potential, increased complexity of strategic needs and a longer pursuit process. 
May also pursue advantageous strategic partnerships with third parties in order to better respond to client/prospects needs. 
May be responsible for executing trades in certain businesses. 
Performs in-depth industry research and maintains an understanding of the market environment, including short- and long-term trends, competitor offerings, regulatory developments etc. in order to achieve account growth or new accounts. 
Generates leads from within existing client accounts or as a results of industry research, prospecting. Incumbents are highly experienced in independently developing leads and initiating contact with prospects. 
Client/prospect contacts are usually institutional leadership. 
Assists lower level peers with complex analyses when needed. 
Consults with clients/prospects on their strategic vision and uses an in-depth understanding of the firms solutions and value proposition to help achieve that vision. May offer customized product offerings. 
Develops a negotiation strategy and position to align client/prospect needs to firm offerings. 
Closes new prospects or new client arrangements by structuring deals (pricing, contract terms, etc.) that achieve optimal terms for both the client and the firm. Ensures deals are compliant with all regulations. 
Marshals firm-wide resources (marketing, legal, compliance, etc.) to ensure the most appropriate response to prospect proposals and deal structure. 
Work closely with related teams (RMs, AMs, CSD) and other firm-wide resources (marketing, legal, compliance, etc.) to ensure all risk management/compliance activities relevant to business development, relationship management, and/or account management activities are conducted and captured. 
Tracks and reports on business development, relationship management, and/or account management results for assigned area (geographic, business/industry category, product category, etc.) 
Builds reports for use by senior leaders that identifies trends, opportunities, potential areas of concern, etc. 
Provides guidance to less experienced business development, relationship management, and/or account management roles as needed. 
Responsible for business development, relationship management, and/or account management within assigned area (geographic territory, product category, business/industry category/segment, etc.). 
Typically pursues emerging, moderately-sized prospects with increasingly complex needs.  Qualifications 

 Bachelors degree or the equivalent combination of education and experience is required.  

 Advanced/graduate degree preferred. 

 Proven work experience preferred in Financial Services with a particular client type or product (Hedge, Pension, etc.) preferred as is prior experience in a related customer-facing role, Sales Support, Global Capital Markets or Product Management.  

 Applicable local/regional licenses or certifications as required by the business.  

 A good understanding of the relevant marketplace, competitive landscape and industry drivers in the relevant region is preferred.  

 As global firm, bi-lingual capabilities are helpful as is an understanding of local/cultural nuances important for client trust.

column4:
This director level role is responsible for research and analysis of complex accounting and reporting issues for BNY Mellon, principally for its EMEA and APAC domiciled businesses.  This includes new and proposed generally accepted accounting principles under both U.S. GAAP and IFRS and is accomplished through financial research, data gathering, planning, and estimation of the impact to the Company.  This role has regular interface with senior management in Finance, business partners, line of business management, and the Company’s auditors.  He/she will often lead accounting change implementation teams, develop related Corporate Accounting Policies, and conduct training of Finance staff and other impacted users.  He/she will monitor proposed accounting standards, including liaising with peers at other financial institutions and participating in external professional groups.   
 This role will also perform ad hoc financial analyses requested by senior management and summarize the impact and any alternatives available to senior management.  Activities could include accounting treatment of acquisitions, divestitures, restructurings, capital market transactions, consolidations, impairments, financial instrument valuations, revenue/expense recognition, employee benefit programs, and differences between FASB and IFRS standards.  He/she may work with external vendors as needed such as valuation firms, actuaries and consultants.   
   
 Candidates should have extensive, broad-based knowledge of advanced financial accounting and reporting concepts and processes; knowledge of and experience in accounting and external reporting requirements in businesses conducted by BNY Mellon; familiarity with the reporting requirements under the U.S Securities and Exchange Commission; excellent verbal, writing and consultative skills; and proven ability to lead cross-functional teams.  Candidate should be proficient with personal computing/software to perform these duties, including systems-based research skills.  Strong business and strategic perspective/focus is essential.   
 The qualified candidate will be educated to degree level and have CPA, ACA or equivalent qualification.  Extensive knowledge of and experience applying U.S. GAAP and IFRS is required.  At least 12-15 years progressive accounting and financial analysis experience required, and experience in an Accounting Policy function with a financial institution or national accounting firm preferred.

Provides guidance to teams managed to ensure that accounting records are maintained in accordance with departmental policies and procedures. Resolves escalated issues from team members.
Evaluates GAAP and/or IFRS rules to determine impact of new regulations on BNY Mellon fund accounting practices.  
Provides guidance to teams on implementation of new policies to follow regulations.
Directs the drafting of financial reports for clients to review fund performance.  Communicates reports and accounting intricacies to clients.  
Recruits, directs, motivates and develops staff, maximizing their individual contribution, their professional growth and their ability to function effectively with their colleagues as a team. 
Leads working relationships with auditors and clients to make changes to financial reports and ensure they accurately depict fund performance. Qualifications

5-7 years of total work experience and at least 0-1 years in management preferred

Prepare, provide and understand Greeks P&L (Delta, Gamma, and Vega etc.) reports to Derivatives Traders.

To analyze and reconcile various reports and trades executed on the Desk.

Assist in any projects which will impact processes and workflows. Prepare analysis of findings to Management.
Run through various Quant models to produce risk and P&L for Trading.
To be able to identify problems and escalate any issues should they arise.
To perform P&L investigations on trade activity where there are discrepancies in Cash Flows, Trade Capture, and Market Data in which analysis is provided to internal or external clients as needed.

Job Purpose
This database engineering role is an opportunity to significantly contribute to the design and delivery of Newton’s data pipelines across multiple database platforms.
This hand on technical role will require the candidate to understand Newton’s database estate and how it is consumed by different groups across the business. This will involve working with business teams to understand their data needs, in addition to working with various development teams to deliver the data.
This is a great role for an experienced database developer/engineer who enjoys a level of business user interaction and enjoys being a data subject matter expert.
 
Company Overview:
Newton Investment Management Limited is an active investment management firm, using thematic ideas about the long-term investment landscape to create and manage strategies that help secure clients’ futures. Newton thinks on a global basis, with its single London-based investment team working collaboratively across asset classes and regions. The firm builds bold solutions, designed to meet the real-world challenges clients face, and the team manage them responsibly in the broadest sense – through embedding environmental, social and governance considerations, and engaging on issues that affect their clients. Those clients are based around the world, and include pension funds, corporations and charities and, via Newton’s parent company BNY Mellon, individuals. 

With offices in London and New York, Newton has £49.8bn assets under management  (as at 31 March 2018), including assets managed by Newton Investment Management Limited as dual officers of Newton Investment Management (North America) Limited and The Bank of New York Mellon. News and other information about Newton is available at www.newtonim.com and via Twitter: @NewtonIM.

Key Responsibilities 
 
·        Hands on responsibility for data engineering of relational databases (Oracle and Microsoft SQL server)
·        Ensure the smooth running of all processes that use or derive data from data feeds
·        Development and maintenance of existing and future data pipelines
·        Analysis and solution construction for ad hoc business data enquiries
·        Provide impact analysis of data change across multiple systems 
·        Contributing to the development of analytics capabilities across the company

·        Making improvements to the build and deployment mechanisms for database changes


 Qualifications Job Specific Competencies 
 
Technical Skills/Systems Knowledge (and associated skill level)


Extensive experience in relational database development, particularly Oracle and MS SQL server

Experience of writing and optimising stored procedures and views to transform and deliver data

Experience using performance, monitoring and alerting tools

Experience in scripting/automation language (Shell, Python)

Familiar with ETL processes

Interest in NoSQL database and BigData concepts and systems

Knowledge of SCRUM or other Agile methodologies

Any experience of Data Architecture and Dimensional Modelling would be a plus

Any experience with Markit EDM would be a plus

Knowledge of investment management, including investment risk, would be a definite plus

Good communicator and collaborator keen to work closely across teams and the business

Take ownership and show a willingness to tackle difficult issues

Embrace, and effectively manage, change

Get hands-on, providing technical direction and/or problem solving to support the team

Ensure all third-party development conforms to organisation best-practice and quality standards

Demonstrate exceptional problem solving skills and intellectual curiosity

Show a passion for innovation and continuous improvement and initiate efforts to implement alternative solutions

 
Preferred but non-essential Technical Skills/Systems Knowledge
 
Academic/Professional Qualifications (or equivalent qualifiers)
·         Formal education in Computer Science, Engineering or related discipline preferred
 
People (team-working/collaboration skills)
 
Self (integrity and the ability to reflect confidence)
 
Results (the ability to be proactive and take action)

Cross-functional Relationship Management and Business Development 
 
Responsibilities:

Independently manages a portfolio of existing clients or prospects, focusing on client satisfaction, relationship building and responsible business growth that is compliant, of acceptable risk and profitable. 
Serves in a consultative role to clients and prospects, advising top leadership on the best way to achieve their short- and long- term strategic objectives through the firms solutions. 
Assists small to moderate emerging institutional prospects or clients with high-growth potential, increased complexity of strategic needs and a longer pursuit process. 
May also pursue advantageous strategic partnerships with third parties in order to better respond to client/prospects needs. 
May be responsible for executing trades in certain businesses. 
Performs in-depth industry research and maintains an understanding of the market environment, including short- and long-term trends, competitor offerings, regulatory developments etc. in order to achieve account growth or new accounts. 
Generates leads from within existing client accounts or as a results of industry research, prospecting. Incumbents are highly experienced in independently developing leads and initiating contact with prospects. 
Client/prospect contacts are usually institutional leadership. 
Assists lower level peers with complex analyses when needed. 
Consults with clients/prospects on their strategic vision and uses an in-depth understanding of the firms solutions and value proposition to help achieve that vision. May offer customized product offerings. 
Develops a negotiation strategy and position to align client/prospect needs to firm offerings. 
Closes new prospects or new client arrangements by structuring deals (pricing, contract terms, etc.) that achieve optimal terms for both the client and the firm. Ensures deals are compliant with all regulations. 
Marshals firm-wide resources (marketing, legal, compliance, etc.) to ensure the most appropriate response to prospect proposals and deal structure. 
Work closely with related teams (RMs, AMs, CSD) and other firm-wide resources (marketing, legal, compliance, etc.) to ensure all risk management/compliance activities relevant to business development, relationship management, and/or account management activities are conducted and captured. 
Tracks and reports on business development, relationship management, and/or account management results for assigned area (geographic, business/industry category, product category, etc.) 
Builds reports for use by senior leaders that identifies trends, opportunities, potential areas of concern, etc. 
Provides guidance to less experienced business development, relationship management, and/or account management roles as needed. 
Responsible for business development, relationship management, and/or account management within assigned area (geographic territory, product category, business/industry category/segment, etc.). 
Typically pursues emerging, moderately-sized prospects with increasingly complex needs.  Qualifications 

 Bachelors degree or the equivalent combination of education and experience is required.  

 Advanced/graduate degree preferred. 

 Proven work experience preferred in Financial Services with a particular client type or product (Hedge, Pension, etc.) preferred as is prior experience in a related customer-facing role, Sales Support, Global Capital Markets or Product Management.  

 Applicable local/regional licenses or certifications as required by the business.  

 A good understanding of the relevant marketplace, competitive landscape and industry drivers in the relevant region is preferred.  

 As global firm, bi-lingual capabilities are helpful as is an understanding of local/cultural nuances important for client trust.

column4:
This director level role is responsible for research and analysis of complex accounting and reporting issues for BNY Mellon, principally for its EMEA and APAC domiciled businesses.  This includes new and proposed generally accepted accounting principles under both U.S. GAAP and IFRS and is accomplished through financial research, data gathering, planning, and estimation of the impact to the Company.  This role has regular interface with senior management in Finance, business partners, line of business management, and the Company’s auditors.  He/she will often lead accounting change implementation teams, develop related Corporate Accounting Policies, and conduct training of Finance staff and other impacted users.  He/she will monitor proposed accounting standards, including liaising with peers at other financial institutions and participating in external professional groups.   
 This role will also perform ad hoc financial analyses requested by senior management and summarize the impact and any alternatives available to senior management.  Activities could include accounting treatment of acquisitions, divestitures, restructurings, capital market transactions, consolidations, impairments, financial instrument valuations, revenue/expense recognition, employee benefit programs, and differences between FASB and IFRS standards.  He/she may work with external vendors as needed such as valuation firms, actuaries and consultants.   
   
 Candidates should have extensive, broad-based knowledge of advanced financial accounting and reporting concepts and processes; knowledge of and experience in accounting and external reporting requirements in businesses conducted by BNY Mellon; familiarity with the reporting requirements under the U.S Securities and Exchange Commission; excellent verbal, writing and consultative skills; and proven ability to lead cross-functional teams.  Candidate should be proficient with personal computing/software to perform these duties, including systems-based research skills.  Strong business and strategic perspective/focus is essential.   
 The qualified candidate will be educated to degree level and have CPA, ACA or equivalent qualification.  Extensive knowledge of and experience applying U.S. GAAP and IFRS is required.  At least 12-15 years progressive accounting and financial analysis experience required, and experience in an Accounting Policy function with a financial institution or national accounting firm preferred.

Provides guidance to teams managed to ensure that accounting records are maintained in accordance with departmental policies and procedures. Resolves escalated issues from team members.
Evaluates GAAP and/or IFRS rules to determine impact of new regulations on BNY Mellon fund accounting practices.  
Provides guidance to teams on implementation of new policies to follow regulations.
Directs the drafting of financial reports for clients to review fund performance.  Communicates reports and accounting intricacies to clients.  
Recruits, directs, motivates and develops staff, maximizing their individual contribution, their professional growth and their ability to function effectively with their colleagues as a team. 
Leads working relationships with auditors and clients to make changes to financial reports and ensure they accurately depict fund performance. Qualifications 
Bachelor’s degree in accounting or the equivalent combination of education and experience is required. 
5-7 years of total work experience and at least 0-1 years in management preferred

May have reporting and project oversight responsibilities. Proactively monitors client orders, order rejects and risk checks. Fields client inquiries and troubleshoot issues. Provides input on the management of trading data across risk, performance and other reporting systems. Provides input on the resolution of errors flagged by trading systems when reconciling with trading partners and back office staff. Streamlines and optimizes processes through workflow design and technology. Develops analysis of the trading cycle and make recommendations for improvement. Develops knowledge of products and vendor requirements. Develops reports, trends and analyses of organization/vendor executions, makes recommendations on process enhancements. Develops knowledge of compliance requirements, control policies and trading standards. Proactively communicates with traders, analysts and other functional groups. Provides traders with pre- and post-executional support. No direct reports. Provide guidance to less experienced analysts. Contributes to the achievement of team goals and objectives. Bachelors degree or the equivalent combination of education and experience is required. 3-5 years of total work experience preferred. Experience in financial investments preferred.  The position will work directly with Traders, Sales and various Back Office teams to provide daily support for reporting and understanding P&L, risk and trade capture. In addition, he or she will be given various ad-hoc projects to work on due to Derivative’s dynamic environment. The ideal candidate should have experience working in a Derivatives trade support or middle office role with 5-7 years’ work experience. The incumbent should be willing to work, to be team oriented, to have good communication skills, to pick up concepts quickly, can multi-task, be detail oriented and to be able to work in a trading environment. Derivatives knowledge within Interest Rates, Equities, and Credit is required. Advanced computer skills and knowledge around VBA is a plus but not required.  
   
 Some responsibilities will include: 
   

Prepare, provide and understand Greeks P&L (Delta, Gamma, and Vega etc.) reports to Derivatives Traders.
Run and understand portfolio analytic reports for risk purposes to provide to Trading.
Mark interest rate curves at the EOD and other market data related activities for pricing (interest rate yield curves, volatility surfaces, security static data maintenance). 
Monitor trading activity on execution platforms and ensure that it STP’s to source system. Perform any OTC or listed trade capture as needed.
To analyze and reconcile various reports and trades executed on the Desk. 
Participate in any UAT testing, upgrades or conversions for all ecommerce, post-execution platforms, and venlinddor related technology. Provide feedback to the Development teams or BNYM Technology support.
Assist in any projects which will impact processes and workflows. Prepare analysis of findings to Management.
Run through various Quant models to produce risk and P&L for Trading.
To be able to identify problems and escalate any issues should they arise.
To perform P&L investigations on trade activity where there are discrepancies in Cash Flows, Trade Capture, and Market Data in which analysis is provided to internal or external clients as needed.
Assist in any ad-hoc projects with requests from Management, Traders and Sales Qualifications Bachelors degree or the equivalent combination of education and experience is required. 3-5 years of total work experience preferred. Experience in financial investments preferred. Applicable local/regional licenses or certifications as required by the business.
 Experience using the following systems is a plus. Summit, WSS, Murex, Broadway, Tradeweb, Bloomberg, Reuters, Markitwire, Fix Flyer, CFOX, Excel  BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.Minorities/Females/Individuals With Disabilities/Protected Veterans.
