column4: Business Development -  Oversees the business development family within the Asset Servicing  business., always through subordinate managers. Sets the strategy for business development in assigned business(es) and develops tactics to execute on that strategy in support of the business unit goals, and focuses on responsible business growth that is compliant, of acceptable risk and profitable. Identifies the markets and areas for future growth and development and ensure staff are deployed accordingly. Participates in and contributes to the development of firm-wide strategy and goals and interfaces regularly with senior leaders and stakeholders. For some areas of the Bank, may be responsible for achieving organic incremental growth from existing clients. Develops and implements the business development strategy for the Asset Servicing business . Owns the business development pipeline and campaign management for assigned business(es). Ensures that subordinate managers effectively develop an operating model/procedures to execute the strategy. Participates in the development of firm-wide strategy. Ensures that business development strategy supports firm-wide strategic goals and objectives. Sets the standards for dealing with unprecedented, complex or intricate issues regarding prospect needs, deal structure, negotiations, priorities, compliance, regulations, etc. Establishes guiding principles or standard operating procedures to ensure consistency of approach across the family. Reviews and approves deal structure ensuring optimal terms for both the client and the firm and mitigating risk where necessary. Ensures deals are compliant with all regulations. Ensures staff have access to the right firm-wide resources (marketing, legal, compliance, etc.) to ensure the most appropriate response to prospect proposals and deal structure. Develops the key metrics and sales analyses that will gauge the success of the business development activities within the family. Tracks and reports on business development results for the function. Leads recruitment efforts and manages and develops teams to maximize their collective contributions. Motivates first line managers to maximize their contributions and encourages professional growth. Continually coaches and monitors skill development of the team, ensuring that team members have access to and take advantage of formal and informal training opportunities, foster mentorships, etc. Actively sources for key roles and identifies candidates with existing relationships that would supplement the Banks relationships. Manages the Business Development family across the firm, within a large business unit or across multiple business units. Work is accomplished through subordinate managers. Responsible for revenue goals within the business unit(s). For some areas of the Bank, may be responsible for achieving organic incremental growth from existing clients. column2: Senior Wealth Manager - New York City
column4:
The Company:
 BNY Mellon is a global investments company dedicated to helping its clients manage and service their financial assets throughout the investment lifecycle. Whether providing financial services for institutions, corporations or individual investors, BNY Mellon delivers informed investment management and investment services in 35 countries and more than 100 markets. As of Dec. 31, 2017, BNY Mellon had $33.3 trillion in assets under custody and/or administration, and $1.9 trillion in assets under management. BNY Mellon can act as a single point of contact for clients looking to create, trade, hold, manage, service, distribute or restructure investments. BNY Mellon is the corporate brand of The Bank of New York Mellon Corporation (NYSE: BK). Additional information is available on www.bnymellon.com. Follow us on Twitter @BNYMellon or visit our newsroom at www.bnymellon.com/newsroom for the latest company news. 
   
 The Division: 
 BNY Mellon Wealth Management is a leading wealth manager. In 2017, it was ranked as a Top 10 U.S. Wealth Manager by Barron’s. It was also awarded Best Private Bank for Customer Service in the U.S. by Financial Times publications Professional Wealth Management and The Banker. The firm has more than two centuries of experience in providing services to clients who today include financially successful individuals and families, their family offices and business enterprises, planned giving programs, and endowments and foundations. It has $238 billion in total client assets, as of December 31, 2017, and an extensive network of offices in the U.S. and internationally. BNY Mellon Wealth Management, which provides investment management, custody, wealth and estate planning and private banking services, conducts business through various operating subsidiaries of The Bank of New York Mellon Corporation. For more information go to bnymellonwealth.com or follow us on Twitter @BNYMellonWealth. 
   
 The Role: 
 The Senior Wealth Manager serves as the trusted advisor to our high net worth clients and their families. In this role, the incumbent provides comprehensive guidance to their clients regarding investment, trust and estate, insurance, tax and banking needs. Senior Wealth Advisors work with clients to design and implement asset allocation strategies and financial plans that meet their unique circumstances, risk tolerance, goals and objectives. S/He develops thoughtful strategies that enhance client service delivery and manage risk. The incumbent will work cooperatively within a team environment to harness all of the firm’s resources on behalf of the client. Additionally, the Senior Wealth Manager will collaborate on potential new business opportunities; and enhance and expand the firm’s relationships with Centers of Influence within the community. In partnership with Wealth Directors, Wealth Manager Fiduciary Specialists and Private Bankers, he/she will be responsible for developing current and future fee business. 
    Qualifications Basic Qualifications:


 An undergraduate degree or equivalent work experience  

 Advanced degree or professional certification 

 8+ years of equivalent experience in the investment management industry  
Preferred Qualifications: 


 10-15 years of portfolio management/wealth advisor experience advising high net worth clients and their families with investment, trust and estate, insurance, tax and banking needs 

 MBA or Master’s Degree  

 CFA®, CFP®, CIMA®, and/or ChFC® professional designations  

 Prior experience managing large and complex family relationships

Client Technology Solutions (CTS) has a mission to provide our business partners with technology based solutions that enhance their ability to be successful through world-class software solutions maintained on a stable and secure infrastructure, and to provide our employees with the tools and means to enhance their professional qualifications and careers. 
   
 This position is responsible for:


 Developing software needed for resiliency, cybersecurity, and Greenfield projects 

 Providing High Availability, resilient, and modern architectural solutions for a high volume, message processing financial application. 
   
 Job Description

Role is to enhance and support critical functions within a high volume, mission critical message processing application, real time interfaces with internal applications on both mainframe and distributed platforms, static data maintenance and updates. 
Provides application software development services or technical support in complex situations.  Represents the application for requirements gathering and BRD/SRD preparation. 
Has thorough knowledge of the Software Development Life Cycle. 
Consults with internal business groups to provide appropriate application software development services or technical support.  Conducts reviews of the test plan and test data. 
May allocate/ coordinate work within a team/project. Works with internal business groups on implementation opportunities, challenges, and requirements of various applications. 
Analyzes information and provides recommendations to address and resolve business issues for a specific business group. 
Coordinates coding, testing, implementation and documentation of solution. 
Ensures that expected application performance levels are achieved. 
Contributes to defining timelines and project plans. 
Analyzes and estimates feasibility, cost, time, and compatibility with hardware and other programs. 
Conducts analysis of organizational needs and goals for the development and implementation of application systems. 
Takes lead for establishing, implementing and monitoring 'best practices' for technical development methodologies and tools. 
Proposes innovative, creative technology solutions.

 Bachelor's degree in computer science engineering or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience.

 Experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus. 

 Knowledge of the Agile methodology for Software Development (prefer Scrum) is a plus. 

 Deep understanding of the software development life cycle.

 Strong analytical skills, excellent problem solver and self-starter.

The Technical Services Manager will:

• Ensure the effective stability of infrastructure systems and the BNYM internal environment
• Ensure the effective use of resources such that the services fully support the business requirements
• Act as a technical expert advisor and management resource for all offices in EMEA and APAC, including India.
• Ensure all works comply with all regulatory and internal law and policy, and ensure that all health and safety practices in the working environment are not compromised.
• Oversee the implementation of planned preventative and corrective maintenance regimes and associated activities 
• Ensure that all works comply with all relevant Codes of Practice and Statutory Regulations together with BNYM own safety regulations, policies and procedures.
• Participate as a member of the wider GS&GRE management team to support positive outcomes for GS&GRE and its clients globally
• Plan and oversee delivery of all Capital works in relation to building infrastructure, and developing life-cycle plans and strategic planning in relation to physical assets, critical systems, and energy management programmes.

• Participate in and oversee relevant energy-related Sustainability initiatives, and support and guide on Sustainability activity in general for the portfolio.  This includes oversight of all energy use and related activity on a cross-regional basis for all locations.
• Ensure budget processes for capital expense spend are delivered effectively, budget plans are met and cost effective services delivered.   This includes financial reporting where appropriate
• Manage and co-ordinate change control systems and processes to support IT-related works Qualifications Qualifications/Experience• A minimum of HNC/Degree in mechanical and electrical engineering (or equivalent) • Expert practical knowledge of Data Centre and office environments; Managing all HVAC systems; and, utilities. • A recognised industry OH&S qualification, such as IOSH or NEBOSH.• Proven delivery in project managing complex services in a live office environment is essential• Excellent knowledge of buildings services; utilities; and Infrastructure

column2: Sr. Specialist Developer – ALM (Asset and Liability Management)
column4:
Sr. Specialist Developer – ALM (Asset and Liability Management) 
The desired candidate will work as a developer on our Asset and Liability Management (ALM) applications for the Treasury and Finance Group’s enhancements. The candidate will consult with internal business groups to provide appropriate application software development services and technical support. Analyzes, defines and documents requirements for data, workflow, logical processes, hardware and operating system environment, interfaces with other systems, internal and external checks, controls, and outputs using BNY Mellon's standard development methodology. Works with internal business groups on implementation opportunities, challenges, and requirements of various applications. Analyzes information and provides recommendations to address and resolve business issues for a specific business group. Contributes to defining time tables and project plans. Analyzes and estimates feasibility, cost, time, and compatibility with hardware and other programs. Takes lead for establishing, implementing and monitoring 'best practices' for technical development methodologies and tools. Proposes innovative, creative technology solutions. Contributes to the achievement of area objectives. 
 
Job Purpose: 
The candidate will work closely with our Technology Teams in India, New York, Manchester and Pittsburgh. The candidate will be responsible for development and systems analysis for various course of business and production support enhancements to continue building out, maintaining, and supporting this critical platform. This will involve:

Application development to support new features, requests, fixes, etc., for the existing development queue and new projects as needed. 
Development work related to CCAR, which will include data tagging, reporting and the building out of historical data sets. 
Be able to read, understand and perform fixes to code in support of daily regulatory reports. 
Work on new business, both project related and course of business. 
Escalate and address any issues affecting daily and monthly batch procedures that may impact delivery to our business users.
The ALM platform is comprised of a large data warehouse built using Microsoft technologies used for optimizing Net Interest Income and for reporting to senior/executive management as well as regulatory bodies (e.g. Basel III, LCR and 5G, CCAR, Federal Reserve). Working on this platform, the candidate will get exposure to many different aspects of the firm.  
 Qualifications
Large data warehouse environment. This includes Microsoft SQL Server, SSIS, and .NET, Angular, API, Pentaho, and Java. S/he must be able to work with the Application Development QA Team to develop testing scripts. S/he must be proactive in finding solutions and able to work well with other Development resources, both onshore and offshore, to provide timely and accurate implementations. 
The preferred candidate will have the following experience, knowledge, and skills:
 
·       Bachelor's degree in computer science engineering or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required, 8-10 years of experience in software development required, experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus.
·       Advanced knowledge and extensive experience working with SQL
·       Experience working within global teams across different locations
·       Experience working with large volumes of data within a data warehouse
·       Experience working with Angular, API, Pentaho, and Java 
·       Working knowledge of data warehouse technical concepts and designs
·       Working knowledge of technical concepts and designs for business intelligence & adhoc/query reporting 
·       Working knowledge of Microsoft SQL Server and SSIS stack
·       Experience working with offshore development teams
·       Excellent oral and written communication skills
·       Advanced skills working with Microsoft Excel
·       Financial industry knowledge, especially as it relates to a balance sheet, is preferred. This includes the types of instruments held by a banking institution for its day to day operations. 
 
In addition to domain and technical expertise, this individual is an expert in prioritization and management. S/he demonstrates a deep understanding of end-to-end operation flows across multiple system applications, expertise and experience with Agile Software Development Life Cycle processes and methodologies, extensive leadership skills, and a deep understanding of application architecture is desired.

Works closely with Application Development and Quality Assurance and Testing teams to understand infrastructure needs during the development and testing processes. Applies IT expertise in strategizing how to best develop infrastructure that will allow development and testing processes to be secure and efficient.Provides input and recommends processes in developing project plans. Monitors project progress and provides regular status reports to management team. Evaluates the effectiveness of the organization's existing infrastructure technology. Stays informed of current industry trends and emerging technologies. Researches and analyzes trends to recommend and implement upgrades that enhance the reliability and efficiency of the IT infrastructure. Contributes to the achievement of area objectives.
 
 Description  

Responsible for design, development, testing and implementation of automated solutions that will interact with multiple third party and internal applications
Collaborate with key stakeholders to gather and analyze control requirements to establish technical as well as functional specifications for Independent Verification and Validation (IVV) of ISD (Information Security) solutions
The ability to conceptualize automated solutions and understand the prescribed design architecture
Develops automated mechanisms via scripting or process to ensure control adoption is sustainable
Present technical concepts and create detailed technical documentation
Provide technical support for IVV solutions
Analyze problems, evaluate technical issues, test, maintain, modify, integrate, monitor and ensure to automate software systems.

Assist with preparing evidence or requirements for evidence for delivery to internal audit, external audit, and regulatory inquiry.
Maintain a standard of regular reporting against our stated targets.
Ownership and accountability for technology domain projects and initiatives Qualifications 
 Required Qualifications 

Minimum one year of hands-on Windows operating systems engineering and troubleshooting
Experience with DevOps, specifically automation
Experience with web service technologies and programming/scripting languages such as Python (3.* preferred), PowerShell, batch, Selenium Automation Framework (SAF), SOAP, REST, Java, C#/.NET, HTML/XML/XAML, Go, JavaScript, Ruby, etc.
Experience with logging formats such as JSON, XML, CEF, syslog, etc.
Strong Operating System (Windows), network and security fundamentals e.g. understanding of networking protocols & applications (TCP/IP, load balancing, firewalls etc.)
Ability to work with Databases - SQL queries
Experience with software development practices – Continuous Integration, Continuous Delivery, Agile/SCRUM, and Source Code Management (GIT), object oriented design, web development frameworks or software design patterns e.g. Jenkins, Ansible, Puppet, Chef, Shell Scripting in Windows environments 
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Bachelor's degree in computer science or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience
 Preferred Qualifications 

Experience with software verification and validation
Experience with reporting and data visualization tools, such as Splunk
Knowledge in Robotic Processing Automation
Knowledge of platform security tools (ie. Antivirus, EDR, NIDS, vulnerability scans, etc.)
Understanding of cloud environments (AWS, Azure, GCP, etc.) and developing within them
Understanding of Device and Access Controls for Windows environments
Experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus.
Industry security certifications such as CISSP/SSCP or GIAC/GSEC a plus.
Masters or other advanced degree a plus
Bachelor's degree in computer science or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required, advanced degree preferred, 8-10 years of related experience required, experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus. column4: Business Development -  Oversees the business development family within the Asset Servicing  business., always through subordinate managers. Sets the strategy for business development in assigned business(es) and develops tactics to execute on that strategy in support of the business unit goals, and focuses on responsible business growth that is compliant, of acceptable risk and profitable. Identifies the markets and areas for future growth and development and ensure staff are deployed accordingly. Participates in and contributes to the development of firm-wide strategy and goals and interfaces regularly with senior leaders and stakeholders. For some areas of the Bank, may be responsible for achieving organic incremental growth from existing clients. Develops and implements the business development strategy for the Asset Servicing business . Owns the business development pipeline and campaign management for assigned business(es). Ensures that subordinate managers effectively develop an operating model/procedures to execute the strategy. Participates in the development of firm-wide strategy. Ensures that business development strategy supports firm-wide strategic goals and objectives. Sets the standards for dealing with unprecedented, complex or intricate issues regarding prospect needs, deal structure, negotiations, priorities, compliance, regulations, etc. Establishes guiding principles or standard operating procedures to ensure consistency of approach across the family. Reviews and approves deal structure ensuring optimal terms for both the client and the firm and mitigating risk where necessary. Ensures deals are compliant with all regulations. Ensures staff have access to the right firm-wide resources (marketing, legal, compliance, etc.) to ensure the most appropriate response to prospect proposals and deal structure. Develops the key metrics and sales analyses that will gauge the success of the business development activities within the family. Tracks and reports on business development results for the function. Leads recruitment efforts and manages and develops teams to maximize their collective contributions. Motivates first line managers to maximize their contributions and encourages professional growth. Continually coaches and monitors skill development of the team, ensuring that team members have access to and take advantage of formal and informal training opportunities, foster mentorships, etc. Actively sources for key roles and identifies candidates with existing relationships that would supplement the Banks relationships. Manages the Business Development family across the firm, within a large business unit or across multiple business units. Work is accomplished through subordinate managers. Responsible for revenue goals within the business unit(s). For some areas of the Bank, may be responsible for achieving organic incremental growth from existing clients. Has human resources management and financial resource management responsibilities. Bachelors degree or the equivalent combination of education and experience is required. Advanced/graduate degree preferred. Typically requires 15 plus years of total work experience and 5-7 years of management experience preferred, preferably in Business Development or a customer-facing role. Applicable local/regional licenses or certifications as required by the business. Qualifications Bachelors degree or the equivalent combination of education and experience is required. column2: Senior Wealth Manager - New York City
column4:
The Company:
 BNY Mellon is a global investments company dedicated to helping its clients manage and service their financial assets throughout the investment lifecycle. Whether providing financial services for institutions, corporations or individual investors, BNY Mellon delivers informed investment management and investment services in 35 countries and more than 100 markets. As of Dec. 31, 2017, BNY Mellon had $33.3 trillion in assets under custody and/or administration, and $1.9 trillion in assets under management. BNY Mellon can act as a single point of contact for clients looking to create, trade, hold, manage, service, distribute or restructure investments. BNY Mellon is the corporate brand of The Bank of New York Mellon Corporation (NYSE: BK). Additional information is available on www.bnymellon.com. Follow us on Twitter @BNYMellon or visit our newsroom at www.bnymellon.com/newsroom for the latest company news. 
   
 The Division: 
 BNY Mellon Wealth Management is a leading wealth manager. In 2017, it was ranked as a Top 10 U.S. Wealth Manager by Barron’s. It was also awarded Best Private Bank for Customer Service in the U.S. by Financial Times publications Professional Wealth Management and The Banker. The firm has more than two centuries of experience in providing services to clients who today include financially successful individuals and families, their family offices and business enterprises, planned giving programs, and endowments and foundations. It has $238 billion in total client assets, as of December 31, 2017, and an extensive network of offices in the U.S. and internationally. BNY Mellon Wealth Management, which provides investment management, custody, wealth and estate planning and private banking services, conducts business through various operating subsidiaries of The Bank of New York Mellon Corporation. For more information go to bnymellonwealth.com or follow us on Twitter @BNYMellonWealth. 
   
 The Role: 
 The Senior Wealth Manager serves as the trusted advisor to our high net worth clients and their families. In this role, the incumbent provides comprehensive guidance to their clients regarding investment, trust and estate, insurance, tax and banking needs. Senior Wealth Advisors work with clients to design and implement asset allocation strategies and financial plans that meet their unique circumstances, risk tolerance, goals and objectives. S/He develops thoughtful strategies that enhance client service delivery and manage risk. The incumbent will work cooperatively within a team environment to harness all of the firm’s resources on behalf of the client. Additionally, the Senior Wealth Manager will collaborate on potential new business opportunities; and enhance and expand the firm’s relationships with Centers of Influence within the community. In partnership with Wealth Directors, Wealth Manager Fiduciary Specialists and Private Bankers, he/she will be responsible for developing current and future fee business. 
    Qualifications Basic Qualifications:


 An undergraduate degree or equivalent work experience  

 Advanced degree or professional certification 

 8+ years of equivalent experience in the investment management industry  
Preferred Qualifications: 


 10-15 years of portfolio management/wealth advisor experience advising high net worth clients and their families with investment, trust and estate, insurance, tax and banking needs 

 MBA or Master’s Degree  

 CFA®, CFP®, CIMA®, and/or ChFC® professional designations  

 Prior experience managing large and complex family relationships

Client Technology Solutions (CTS) has a mission to provide our business partners with technology based solutions that enhance their ability to be successful through world-class software solutions maintained on a stable and secure infrastructure, and to provide our employees with the tools and means to enhance their professional qualifications and careers. 
   
 This position is responsible for:


 Developing software needed for resiliency, cybersecurity, and Greenfield projects 

 Providing High Availability, resilient, and modern architectural solutions for a high volume, message processing financial application. 
   
 Job Description

Role is to enhance and support critical functions within a high volume, mission critical message processing application, real time interfaces with internal applications on both mainframe and distributed platforms, static data maintenance and updates. 
Provides application software development services or technical support in complex situations.  Represents the application for requirements gathering and BRD/SRD preparation. 
Has thorough knowledge of the Software Development Life Cycle. 
Consults with internal business groups to provide appropriate application software development services or technical support.  Conducts reviews of the test plan and test data. 
May allocate/ coordinate work within a team/project. Works with internal business groups on implementation opportunities, challenges, and requirements of various applications. 
Analyzes information and provides recommendations to address and resolve business issues for a specific business group. 
Coordinates coding, testing, implementation and documentation of solution. 
Ensures that expected application performance levels are achieved. 
Contributes to defining timelines and project plans. 
Analyzes and estimates feasibility, cost, time, and compatibility with hardware and other programs. 
Conducts analysis of organizational needs and goals for the development and implementation of application systems. 
Takes lead for establishing, implementing and monitoring 'best practices' for technical development methodologies and tools. 
Proposes innovative, creative technology solutions.

 Strong analytical skills, excellent problem solver and self-starter.

ISD CAO Management Office

Executing analysis and plan of work to ensure ISD financials around Cost Pools, CapEx, OpEx and how waterfall services provided by other organizations (internal and external) are all accounted for correctly in the Service cost allocation.
Assisting Service owners with a self-managed approach to their finances.
Manage Major Expenditure/Deal Process partnering with Procurement, Capital Controllers, Major Expenditures and Accounts Payable. column2: Sr. Specialist Developer – ALM (Asset and Liability Management)
column4:
Sr. Specialist Developer – ALM (Asset and Liability Management) 
The desired candidate will work as a developer on our Asset and Liability Management (ALM) applications for the Treasury and Finance Group’s enhancements. The candidate will consult with internal business groups to provide appropriate application software development services and technical support. Analyzes, defines and documents requirements for data, workflow, logical processes, hardware and operating system environment, interfaces with other systems, internal and external checks, controls, and outputs using BNY Mellon's standard development methodology. Works with internal business groups on implementation opportunities, challenges, and requirements of various applications. Analyzes information and provides recommendations to address and resolve business issues for a specific business group. Contributes to defining time tables and project plans. Analyzes and estimates feasibility, cost, time, and compatibility with hardware and other programs. Takes lead for establishing, implementing and monitoring 'best practices' for technical development methodologies and tools. Proposes innovative, creative technology solutions. Contributes to the achievement of area objectives. 
 
Job Purpose: 
The candidate will work closely with our Technology Teams in India, New York, Manchester and Pittsburgh. The candidate will be responsible for development and systems analysis for various course of business and production support enhancements to continue building out, maintaining, and supporting this critical platform. This will involve:

Application development to support new features, requests, fixes, etc., for the existing development queue and new projects as needed. 
Development work related to CCAR, which will include data tagging, reporting and the building out of historical data sets. 
Be able to read, understand and perform fixes to code in support of daily regulatory reports. 
Work on new business, both project related and course of business. 
Escalate and address any issues affecting daily and monthly batch procedures that may impact delivery to our business users.
The ALM platform is comprised of a large data warehouse built using Microsoft technologies used for optimizing Net Interest Income and for reporting to senior/executive management as well as regulatory bodies (e.g. Basel III, LCR and 5G, CCAR, Federal Reserve). Working on this platform, the candidate will get exposure to many different aspects of the firm.  
 Qualifications
Large data warehouse environment. This includes Microsoft SQL Server, SSIS, and .NET, Angular, API, Pentaho, and Java. S/he must be able to work with the Application Development QA Team to develop testing scripts. S/he must be proactive in finding solutions and able to work well with other Development resources, both onshore and offshore, to provide timely and accurate implementations. 
The preferred candidate will have the following experience, knowledge, and skills:
 
·       Bachelor's degree in computer science engineering or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required, 8-10 years of experience in software development required, experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus.
·       Advanced knowledge and extensive experience working with SQL
·       Experience working within global teams across different locations
·       Experience working with large volumes of data within a data warehouse
·       Experience working with Angular, API, Pentaho, and Java 
·       Working knowledge of data warehouse technical concepts and designs
·       Working knowledge of technical concepts and designs for business intelligence & adhoc/query reporting 
·       Working knowledge of Microsoft SQL Server and SSIS stack
·       Experience working with offshore development teams
·       Excellent oral and written communication skills
·       Advanced skills working with Microsoft Excel
·       Financial industry knowledge, especially as it relates to a balance sheet, is preferred. This includes the types of instruments held by a banking institution for its day to day operations. 
 
In addition to domain and technical expertise, this individual is an expert in prioritization and management. S/he demonstrates a deep understanding of end-to-end operation flows across multiple system applications, expertise and experience with Agile Software Development Life Cycle processes and methodologies, extensive leadership skills, and a deep understanding of application architecture is desired.

 Description

column2: Prin, Model Dev (Market Risk Quant Modeler)
column4:
This is a Market Risk Quant Modeler role.  The primary responsibilities are designing, testing, and maintaining market risk models and risk analytics tools using visual C++, Python scripts, and VBA.  Metrics will include VaR, derivative pricing, Monte Carlo implementation and optimization.  Collaborate with Desk Risk Managers, Model Validation team, IT, and Market Data groups. 
  The Principal (Financial Modeling Project Lead) will direct projects to develop or modify a suite of complex or interconnected models. The models make estimates that are a key input to management decisions and are reported to Senior Management and the Board of Directors on a regular basis. The role will be to oversee execution of corporate-wide standards for model development on a large and/or interconnected scale. The incumbent will be responsible for identifying problems that can be solved by the application of financial theory and building models that improve the firm's operation. The incumbent will be expected to plan the timing and resources for significant projects and provide intellectual leadership in terms of conducting cutting-edge research, identifying latest trends and developments in modeling, and recommending alternative solutions to analytically challenging problems. The incumbent may lead the work of analysts in one of five disciplines, each responsible for a different type of modeling: 1) Credit Risk Modeling 2) Treasury Modeling 3) Market Risk Modeling 4) Pricing Modeling 5) Forecasting For modeling activities that occur on a large or interconnected scale, the incumbent will create development schedules and ensure analyst resources are assigned. Execute corporate-wide standards for model development, by setting the scope of development efforts for complex and/or interconnected models. This entails determining the frameworks that will be used, the source data that should be collected, assumptions that should be made, and the outcomes that need to be reviewed. Evaluate the strengths and weaknesses of framework options and identify which is most likely to meet the needs of the business. Reviews accuracy of reports and calculations performed by less experienced colleagues; ensures proper model documentation is being put in place. Support the validation of models; the incumbent is expected to ensure testing and analysis is provided at the request of Model Risk Management. The incumbent will be responsible for arranging performance monitoring of models, identifying possible deteriorating by comparing outcomes to established thresholds. No direct reports; provides guidance to more junior analysts. Responsible for the indirect supervision of team members and coordination of resources. Modified based upon local regulations/requirements. Qualifications Master's Degree/PhD in a quantitative discipline, including engineering, mathematics, physics, statistics, economics. The candidate must have a superb quantitative and analytical background with a solid theoretical foundation coupled with strong programming, documentation and communications skills. 5 years with Masters or 3-years with PhD required. Must have experience with complex quantitative modeling, numerical analysis, and computational methods using programming languages (such as C/C++, C#, Java, FORTRAN, MATLAB, SAS) as well as mathematical/statistical software packages. Must be extremely focused, detail oriented, results oriented and highly productive. Must have a proven track record of being able to efficiently and effectively conduct independent research, analyze problems, formulate and implement solutions, and produce quality results on time. The candidate must have excellent scientific and technical documentation and presentation skills, assertiveness & influencing skills, and the skills to explain abstract theoretical concepts to a non-expert audience in easy-to-understand language.

column2: SrPrin, Mkt (Liq) Risk (Market Risk Mgr - Structured Products)
column4:
Provide Market Risk coverage of Structured Products (ex. Non-Agency/Private Label RMBS as well as CLO's)  Roughly 80% MBS & 20% CLO's.  Products are accepted by BNY Mellon as collateral in Sec Lending transactions that we finance. 
  Partners with senior management to ensure that the appropriate market or liquidity risk policies, methods, standards, processes, and training are developed, applied and understood by impacted stakeholders. Applies comprehensive knowledge of market or liquidity risk analysis, monitoring processes and in-depth knowledge of the financial industry, technology and the requirements of regulatory bodies. Serves as a key resource to the head of market or liquidity risk and the business, and provides leadership to the group on risk analysis, monitoring, and regulatory issues. Oversees the management of all activities related to the development and production of risk platforms and metrics. Plans and implements the risk policies and procedures and internal controls across multiple businesses and locations. Interacts frequently with front office senior management and other business areas to provide inputs on issues related to trading, portfolio or liquidity risk, market or liquidity conditions, and regulatory matters. Develops infrastructure that is used to measure the Bank's risk taking activities related to trading and portfolio or liquidity management. Promotes broad understanding of risk controls and ensures they are communicated accurately to the target audience. No direct reports; oversees, advises and guides experienced Market or Liquidity Risk roles and likely directs their work. Responsibilities are primarily specialized to address the market or liquidity risk management needs for major global initiatives, large areas of the business, specific legal entities, or material events. Modified based upon local regulations/requirements.   Qualifications Bachelor s Degree or the equivalent combination of education and experience is required. Masters degree or PhD preferred. Family Requirements: 12-15 years of experience in market or liquidity risk preferred. Experience in financial services is strongly preferred. Background in math, statistics, finance, economics, risk management, operations research, or a similar field is preferred. Discipline Requirements: Market Risk: Ability to analyze and report on financial products and financial risk, macroeconomic issues, interest rate risk, and relevant regulation (e.g., Volcker, CCAR, DFAST, SLR, IRRBB). Liquidity Risk: Ability to assist with analysis of and reporting on funding, cash flow projections, deposits (including operational and behavioral views), liquidity measures, liquidity stress testing and relevant regulation (e.g. CLAR/ILAA, LCR). column2: SrPrin, Credit Risk (Credit Risk Portfolio Mgr)
column4:
The Credit Risk Portfolio Manager would have substantive bank underwriting experience in Real Estate lending including REITs, Private Developers & Corporate Owners, Construction Lending as well as LIHTC and Affordable Housing.  The candidate should be very well versed in NYC RE and have some familiarity with other metro areas such as DC & Boston.  It would be expected that such a candidate would also be familiar with various regulatory requirements such as HVCRE, CCAR, etc.  This position would report to the Credit Division Head of Real Estate.
 
The CPM is responsible for executing the credit strategy of the Firm.  The CPM is ultimately responsible for the credit quality of the portfolios, review and approval of credit requests and accurate and timely ratings incorporating market based monitoring. The CPM will have Level 1 credit authority*. The incumbent and his/her team will coordinate the BNY Mellon effort to ensure that the risk/reward balance is consistent with the company’s strategy and is responsive to the client.  The CPM manages the process, and develops a team of professionals that include Lenders, Analysts and Portfolio Administrators to achieve the above objectives.  The position requires strong and decisive credit judgment based in part on insightful incorporation of market based tools/resources.  The CPM facilitates the setting/recommendation of optimal customer credit exposure targets for approval based on collaborative interaction with the customer, relationship managers and BNY Mellon product areas.  The CPM is responsible for the timely and accurate rating of each borrower in the portfolio and must promptly escalate deteriorating credit situations.  The CPM is expected to work closely with his/her counterparts in market risk, global markets counterparty risk, Operational Credit Risk and the relevant line of business (LOB) Chief Risk Officers (CROs) to ensure that all client related risks are understood and that the relevant risk groups are apprised of relevant risk issues as they arise. 

Handling credit requests and needs of customers both internally and externally to determine appropriate level of credit extension.  
As noted in the summary job description, these positions interact with the senior client facing officers in both LOBs and GCM.  The breadth of these positions is enterprise wide. 
These positions have a high degree of interaction with salespeople in the LOBs and in Global Client Management. Review and approval of credit requests and accurate and timely ratings.
Internal and external presentation, communications and organizational skills are a prerequisite. Qualifications Modified based upon local regulations/requirements. Bachelor s degree or related technical discipline, or the equivalent combination of education and experience is required. Formal credit training preferred. MBA preferred. Family Requirements: 12-15 years of total work experience preferred. Prior experience/background in credit risk preferred. In addition, may require the following experience/skills based on primary duties: Discipline Requirements: Credit Analysis & Approval/Portfolio Management: Formal credit training preferred. Ability to assist with the management of diverse lending, operating products, attendant risk, foreclosure, bankruptcy and/or OREO assets. Operational Credit Risk: Formal credit training preferred. Experience as an underwriter and assisting with the management of rapid-turnaround, intraday funds transfers and approvals. Country Risk: Formal credit training preferred. Experience with borrower rating systems and tracking methodologies, and basic knowledge of fiscal and financial condition indicators. Credit Administration: Experience as an underwriter and familiarity with credit administration systems typically used by financial institutions. Community Reinvestment Act/Appraisal: Expert-level familiarity with the Community Reinvestment Act and extensive experience conducting complex real estate appraisals. BNY Mellon is a leading provider of financial services for institutions, corporations and high-net-worth individuals, providing superior asset management and wealth management, asset servicing, issuer services, clearing services and treasury services through a worldwide client-focused team. 
Job Purpose:
A fantastic opportunity to join BNY Mellon’s Apprenticeship programme across the business based in one of our two Manchester city centre locations. The exact role will be determined during the application process, but you will be assigned to a role that matches your interests and skills.  
 
Responsibilities:
The administrator is responsible for ensuring all assigned tasks are performed both accurately and timely whilst adhering to all procedures and controls, and thus minimizing risks and potential losses to the organisation. Other responsibilities include:
·         Processing workloads, meeting deadlines to ensure timely completion of client transactions
·         Administration duties 
·         Investigation of items as per client requests
·         Control and Reporting to meet regulatory requirements
·         Reconciliation of workloads to ensure accurate book keeping
·         Problem solving and idea generation to improve processes
Skills and Experience:
·         Problem solving
·         Computer literate and good level of excel skills
·         Strong numeracy understanding
·         Attention to detail
·         Initiative
·         Organisation & time management
·         Conscientious 
·         Communication skills
·         5 GCSEs A* to C including Math and English
Apprenticeship tasks:

Level 3 NVQ Qualification – personal development and evidence pack to be created and maintained. 
Assessments – units are selected to match your specific job role, but include improving customer relationships, reconciling investment market transactions and developing productive working relationships.  
Completion of IOC exams – a Financial Services industry recognised qualification. Qualifications . The Asset Servicing EMEA Solutions Marketing Lead will report to the Global Head of Solutions Marketing based in New York and will work closely with the segment marketing teams globally. This position plays a leadership role in driving growth for the asset servicing business in EMEA. 
   
 This individual will be responsible for creating value propositions, thought leaderships and solutions content for clients and generating demand with new clients, as well as existing clients.  The individual will focus on creating and managing marketing programs to promote experts and solutions with institutional clients across EMEA and globally, including the launch of new products, across channels including digital, social, advertising and events. Ideally this person is highly organized, creative, detail-focused, and a team player. 
   
 Critical to the individual’s success is the ability to work within Marketing (Segment Marketing, Corporate Communications, Digital Marketing, Design and Sales Enablement) to execute on marketing programs. 
  Scope of Responsibility


 Develop a marketing plan across the asset servicing solutions suite that aligns with segment marketing teams, product and front-line teams to ensure programs are delivered on-time and on budget. 

 Develop and manage marketing programs for ongoing revenue growth and to support new launches and key campaigns and ensure all content is aligned with the value proposition and brand guidelines. 

 Work with subject-matter experts to create content that’s relevant, easy to understand and, importantly, conveys the benefit of our capabilities to the client, including web content, videos, sales presentations, factsheets and brochures and RFP responses. 
   
  Specific Knowledge/Skills 

 Good understanding of the financial marketplace and how it impacts the investment process. Knowledge of the fund industry would be a beneficial. 

 Proven ability to communicate effectively to key stakeholders and to create consistent messaging 

 Strong attention to detail, excellent organizational skills, work well under pressure and prioritize to meet deadlines 

 Must be self-motivated, adaptable and able to work in a changing environment    #LI-SM1                  Qualifications


 Confident self-starter with leadership qualities and ability to work in a matrix work environment and establish strong partnerships

The Manager oversees the service delivered by a Fund Accounting operational team.  He/She is responsible for the scheduling of operational flows, that the necessary controls are in place and adhered to in order to provide accurate and timely fund accounting/administration services to our clients.
Responsibilities:
Provision of fund administration services:
• Ensure the accounting records of client funds are accurate, complete, and up to date.
• Ensure the net asset values (NAVs)/dividend factors/weighted average maturities are calculated according to agreed standard and client specific procedures and timetables.
• Ensure the necessary controls are in place and adhered to in order to provide complete, accurate and timely fund administration services to our clients. Such responsibility includes adherence by all team members to BNY Mellon Operations Procedures Manual and to the client service level agreements (SLAs).
• Maintain/update client standing files including client-specific procedures (detailing client-agreed deviations from or additions to standard procedures contained in the Procedures Manual) on a timely basis and ensure existing and new procedures agreed with our clients are formally communicated to the necessary staff as soon as required.
• Provide non-daily services to all clients including month-end reporting, compliance review and expense payments.
• Ensure the team is providing and receiving complete and accurate data and information from all internal parties.
Other areas of responsibility include:
• Relationship management.
• Human resources issues.
• Monitoring of quality control.
• Management of IT issues.
• Training.
• Management reporting/Financial control.
• Conversion projects.
 
What we are looking for:
 
• Fluency in English is essential and fluency in Polish is preferable.
• Exensive work experience in Financial Services or Accounting, preferably in multinational organisation..
• Self-motivated with the ability to work on projects in a team environment as well as stand-alone.
• Proven process and team management skills
• Proactive, focused attitude towards work and an ability to consistently meet deadlines in a dynamic and fast paced environment.
• Strong organisational, inter-personal, communication and presentation skills.
• Proven skills in strategic planning and analysis for administration operations.
• Ability to lead subordinates and develop/mentor staff.

column4:
BNY Mellon is seeking a qualified candidate to manage the migration of Private Equity Funds onto the end-state waterfall solution.  This Manager will lead the project implementation team that supports the conversion of Funds onto Cascade Suite, an automated waterfall vendor solution that is integrated with Investran, the current accounting platform for the Alternative Investment Services group.  In addition, this person will oversee the development of Excel models that support complex waterfall calculations. • Bachelor’s degree in accounting or the equivalent combination of education and experience is required • 7+ years of Private Equity Fund accounting experience, including waterfall analysis and specification and/or development strongly preferred • Investran and Cascade proficiency strongly preferred • Waterfall Software strongly preferred • Advanced Excel required; VBA programming a strong plus • Strong analytical and quantitative skills • Ability to read and analyze a Fund Limited Partnership Agreement (“LPA”), the legal document that governs the waterfall calculation strongly preferred • Ability to translate language from LPA to business requirements strongly preferred • Desire and proven ability to master accounting applications strongly preferred • Experience in large systems conversion projects a plus strongly preferred  For over 230 years, the people of BNY Mellon have been at the forefront of finance, expanding the financial markets while supporting investors throughout the investment lifecycle. The Corporate Actions Accounting Department performs both mandatory and voluntary corporate action related accounting processing functions in over 65 markets for Bank of New York Mellon s clients. The group is responsible for managing and controlling high levels of risk and liability inherent in the various functions. The incumbent is responsible for processing both mandatory and voluntary corporate actions accounting functions related to international and US securities for all Bank of New York Mellon accounts. S/He is responsible for processing basic to moderately intricate corporate action events for multiple markets. This includes the daily interpretation, monitoring, and scrubbing of corporate action events as well as the monitoring and posting of accruals to client accounts. S/he will work on multiple Bank of New York Mellon systems including three different accounting platforms, as well as with vendor products such as Bloomberg and FT Interactive Data, to ensure the correct cost analysis; tax treatment and market impact is reviewed for each corporate action event prior to posting the actual online cash and security transactions for each account. The incumbent is responsible for adhering to established quality control measures and procedures. S/He will interact daily with external vendor support representatives, individual company investor relation contacts, and other internal business groups including Corporate Actions Custody, Service Delivery and Pricing teams. S/he is responsible for understanding market-specific requirements for corporate actions accounting processing.

column2: Prin, Model Dev (Market Risk Quant Modeler)
column4:
This is a Market Risk Quant Modeler role.  The primary responsibilities are designing, testing, and maintaining market risk models and risk analytics tools using visual C++, Python scripts, and VBA.  Metrics will include VaR, derivative pricing, Monte Carlo implementation and optimization.  Collaborate with Desk Risk Managers, Model Validation team, IT, and Market Data groups. 
  The Principal (Financial Modeling Project Lead) will direct projects to develop or modify a suite of complex or interconnected models. The models make estimates that are a key input to management decisions and are reported to Senior Management and the Board of Directors on a regular basis. The role will be to oversee execution of corporate-wide standards for model development on a large and/or interconnected scale. The incumbent will be responsible for identifying problems that can be solved by the application of financial theory and building models that improve the firm's operation. The incumbent will be expected to plan the timing and resources for significant projects and provide intellectual leadership in terms of conducting cutting-edge research, identifying latest trends and developments in modeling, and recommending alternative solutions to analytically challenging problems. The incumbent may lead the work of analysts in one of five disciplines, each responsible for a different type of modeling: 1) Credit Risk Modeling 2) Treasury Modeling 3) Market Risk Modeling 4) Pricing Modeling 5) Forecasting For modeling activities that occur on a large or interconnected scale, the incumbent will create development schedules and ensure analyst resources are assigned. Execute corporate-wide standards for model development, by setting the scope of development efforts for complex and/or interconnected models. This entails determining the frameworks that will be used, the source data that should be collected, assumptions that should be made, and the outcomes that need to be reviewed. Evaluate the strengths and weaknesses of framework options and identify which is most likely to meet the needs of the business. Reviews accuracy of reports and calculations performed by less experienced colleagues; ensures proper model documentation is being put in place. Support the validation of models; the incumbent is expected to ensure testing and analysis is provided at the request of Model Risk Management. The incumbent will be responsible for arranging performance monitoring of models, identifying possible deteriorating by comparing outcomes to established thresholds. No direct reports; provides guidance to more junior analysts. Responsible for the indirect supervision of team members and coordination of resources. Modified based upon local regulations/requirements. Qualifications Master's Degree/PhD in a quantitative discipline, including engineering, mathematics, physics, statistics, economics. The candidate must have a superb quantitative and analytical background with a solid theoretical foundation coupled with strong programming, documentation and communications skills. 5 years with Masters or 3-years with PhD required. Must have experience with complex quantitative modeling, numerical analysis, and computational methods using programming languages (such as C/C++, C#, Java, FORTRAN, MATLAB, SAS) as well as mathematical/statistical software packages. Must be extremely focused, detail oriented, results oriented and highly productive. Must have a proven track record of being able to efficiently and effectively conduct independent research, analyze problems, formulate and implement solutions, and produce quality results on time. The candidate must have excellent scientific and technical documentation and presentation skills, assertiveness & influencing skills, and the skills to explain abstract theoretical concepts to a non-expert audience in easy-to-understand language.

column2: SrPrin, Mkt (Liq) Risk (Market Risk Mgr - Structured Products)
column4:
Provide Market Risk coverage of Structured Products (ex. Non-Agency/Private Label RMBS as well as CLO's)  Roughly 80% MBS & 20% CLO's.  Products are accepted by BNY Mellon as collateral in Sec Lending transactions that we finance. 
  Partners with senior management to ensure that the appropriate market or liquidity risk policies, methods, standards, processes, and training are developed, applied and understood by impacted stakeholders. Applies comprehensive knowledge of market or liquidity risk analysis, monitoring processes and in-depth knowledge of the financial industry, technology and the requirements of regulatory bodies. Serves as a key resource to the head of market or liquidity risk and the business, and provides leadership to the group on risk analysis, monitoring, and regulatory issues. Oversees the management of all activities related to the development and production of risk platforms and metrics. Plans and implements the risk policies and procedures and internal controls across multiple businesses and locations. Interacts frequently with front office senior management and other business areas to provide inputs on issues related to trading, portfolio or liquidity risk, market or liquidity conditions, and regulatory matters. Develops infrastructure that is used to measure the Bank's risk taking activities related to trading and portfolio or liquidity management. Promotes broad understanding of risk controls and ensures they are communicated accurately to the target audience. No direct reports; oversees, advises and guides experienced Market or Liquidity Risk roles and likely directs their work. Responsibilities are primarily specialized to address the market or liquidity risk management needs for major global initiatives, large areas of the business, specific legal entities, or material events. Modified based upon local regulations/requirements.   Qualifications Bachelor s Degree or the equivalent combination of education and experience is required. Masters degree or PhD preferred. Family Requirements: 12-15 years of experience in market or liquidity risk preferred. Experience in financial services is strongly preferred. Background in math, statistics, finance, economics, risk management, operations research, or a similar field is preferred. Discipline Requirements: Market Risk: Ability to analyze and report on financial products and financial risk, macroeconomic issues, interest rate risk, and relevant regulation (e.g., Volcker, CCAR, DFAST, SLR, IRRBB). Liquidity Risk: Ability to assist with analysis of and reporting on funding, cash flow projections, deposits (including operational and behavioral views), liquidity measures, liquidity stress testing and relevant regulation (e.g. CLAR/ILAA, LCR). column2: SrPrin, Credit Risk (Credit Risk Portfolio Mgr)
column4:
The Credit Risk Portfolio Manager would have substantive bank underwriting experience in Real Estate lending including REITs, Private Developers & Corporate Owners, Construction Lending as well as LIHTC and Affordable Housing.  The candidate should be very well versed in NYC RE and have some familiarity with other metro areas such as DC & Boston.  It would be expected that such a candidate would also be familiar with various regulatory requirements such as HVCRE, CCAR, etc.  This position would report to the Credit Division Head of Real Estate.
 
The CPM is responsible for executing the credit strategy of the Firm.  The CPM is ultimately responsible for the credit quality of the portfolios, review and approval of credit requests and accurate and timely ratings incorporating market based monitoring. The CPM will have Level 1 credit authority*. The incumbent and his/her team will coordinate the BNY Mellon effort to ensure that the risk/reward balance is consistent with the company’s strategy and is responsive to the client.  The CPM manages the process, and develops a team of professionals that include Lenders, Analysts and Portfolio Administrators to achieve the above objectives.  The position requires strong and decisive credit judgment based in part on insightful incorporation of market based tools/resources.  The CPM facilitates the setting/recommendation of optimal customer credit exposure targets for approval based on collaborative interaction with the customer, relationship managers and BNY Mellon product areas.  The CPM is responsible for the timely and accurate rating of each borrower in the portfolio and must promptly escalate deteriorating credit situations.  The CPM is expected to work closely with his/her counterparts in market risk, global markets counterparty risk, Operational Credit Risk and the relevant line of business (LOB) Chief Risk Officers (CROs) to ensure that all client related risks are understood and that the relevant risk groups are apprised of relevant risk issues as they arise. 

Handling credit requests and needs of customers both internally and externally to determine appropriate level of credit extension.  
As noted in the summary job description, these positions interact with the senior client facing officers in both LOBs and GCM.  The breadth of these positions is enterprise wide. 
These positions have a high degree of interaction with salespeople in the LOBs and in Global Client Management. Review and approval of credit requests and accurate and timely ratings.
Internal and external presentation, communications and organizational skills are a prerequisite. Qualifications Modified based upon local regulations/requirements. Overview Of BNY Mellon:BNY Mellon is a global financial services company focused on helping clients manage and service their financial assets, operating in 36 countries and serving more than 100 markets. BNY Mellon is a leading provider of financial services for institutions, corporations and high-net-worth individuals, providing superior asset management and wealth management, asset servicing, issuer services, clearing services and treasury services through a worldwide client-focused team. 
Job Purpose:
A fantastic opportunity to join BNY Mellon’s Apprenticeship programme across the business based in one of our two Manchester city centre locations. The exact role will be determined during the application process, but you will be assigned to a role that matches your interests and skills.  
 
Responsibilities:
The administrator is responsible for ensuring all assigned tasks are performed both accurately and timely whilst adhering to all procedures and controls, and thus minimizing risks and potential losses to the organisation. Other responsibilities include:
·         Processing workloads, meeting deadlines to ensure timely completion of client transactions
·         Administration duties 
·         Investigation of items as per client requests
·         Control and Reporting to meet regulatory requirements
·         Reconciliation of workloads to ensure accurate book keeping
·         Problem solving and idea generation to improve processes
Skills and Experience:
·         Problem solving
·         Computer literate and good level of excel skills
·         Strong numeracy understanding
·         Attention to detail
·         Initiative
·         Organisation & time management
·         Conscientious 
·         Communication skills
·         5 GCSEs A* to C including Math and English

Level 3 NVQ Qualification – personal development and evidence pack to be created and maintained. 
Assessments – units are selected to match your specific job role, but include improving customer relationships, reconciling investment market transactions and developing productive working relationships.  
Completion of IOC exams – a Financial Services industry recognised qualification. Qualifications . The Asset Servicing EMEA Solutions Marketing Lead will report to the Global Head of Solutions Marketing based in New York and will work closely with the segment marketing teams globally. This position plays a leadership role in driving growth for the asset servicing business in EMEA. 
   
 This individual will be responsible for creating value propositions, thought leaderships and solutions content for clients and generating demand with new clients, as well as existing clients.  The individual will focus on creating and managing marketing programs to promote experts and solutions with institutional clients across EMEA and globally, including the launch of new products, across channels including digital, social, advertising and events. Ideally this person is highly organized, creative, detail-focused, and a team player. 
   
 Critical to the individual’s success is the ability to work within Marketing (Segment Marketing, Corporate Communications, Digital Marketing, Design and Sales Enablement) to execute on marketing programs. 
  Scope of Responsibility


 Develop a marketing plan across the asset servicing solutions suite that aligns with segment marketing teams, product and front-line teams to ensure programs are delivered on-time and on budget. 

 Develop and manage marketing programs for ongoing revenue growth and to support new launches and key campaigns and ensure all content is aligned with the value proposition and brand guidelines. 

 Work with subject-matter experts to create content that’s relevant, easy to understand and, importantly, conveys the benefit of our capabilities to the client, including web content, videos, sales presentations, factsheets and brochures and RFP responses. 
   
  Specific Knowledge/Skills 

 Good understanding of the financial marketplace and how it impacts the investment process. Knowledge of the fund industry would be a beneficial. 

 Proven ability to communicate effectively to key stakeholders and to create consistent messaging 

 Strong attention to detail, excellent organizational skills, work well under pressure and prioritize to meet deadlines 

 Must be self-motivated, adaptable and able to work in a changing environment    #LI-SM1                  Qualifications


 Confident self-starter with leadership qualities and ability to work in a matrix work environment and establish strong partnerships

The Manager oversees the service delivered by a Fund Accounting operational team.  He/She is responsible for the scheduling of operational flows, that the necessary controls are in place and adhered to in order to provide accurate and timely fund accounting/administration services to our clients.
Responsibilities:
Provision of fund administration services:
• Ensure the accounting records of client funds are accurate, complete, and up to date.
• Ensure the net asset values (NAVs)/dividend factors/weighted average maturities are calculated according to agreed standard and client specific procedures and timetables.
• Ensure the necessary controls are in place and adhered to in order to provide complete, accurate and timely fund administration services to our clients. Such responsibility includes adherence by all team members to BNY Mellon Operations Procedures Manual and to the client service level agreements (SLAs).
• Maintain/update client standing files including client-specific procedures (detailing client-agreed deviations from or additions to standard procedures contained in the Procedures Manual) on a timely basis and ensure existing and new procedures agreed with our clients are formally communicated to the necessary staff as soon as required.
• Provide non-daily services to all clients including month-end reporting, compliance review and expense payments.
• Ensure the team is providing and receiving complete and accurate data and information from all internal parties.
Other areas of responsibility include:
• Relationship management.
• Human resources issues.
• Monitoring of quality control.
• Management of IT issues.
• Training.
• Management reporting/Financial control.
• Conversion projects.
 
What we are looking for:
 
• Fluency in English is essential and fluency in Polish is preferable.
• Exensive work experience in Financial Services or Accounting, preferably in multinational organisation..
• Self-motivated with the ability to work on projects in a team environment as well as stand-alone.
• Proven process and team management skills
• Proactive, focused attitude towards work and an ability to consistently meet deadlines in a dynamic and fast paced environment.
• Strong organisational, inter-personal, communication and presentation skills.
• Proven skills in strategic planning and analysis for administration operations.
• Ability to lead subordinates and develop/mentor staff.

column2: Specialist, Fund/Client Accounting (Private Equity Fund Accounting and Waterfall Analysis)
column4:
BNY Mellon is seeking a qualified candidate to manage the migration of Private Equity Funds onto the end-state waterfall solution.  This Manager will lead the project implementation team that supports the conversion of Funds onto Cascade Suite, an automated waterfall vendor solution that is integrated with Investran, the current accounting platform for the Alternative Investment Services group.  In addition, this person will oversee the development of Excel models that support complex waterfall calculations.  Qualifications
• Bachelor’s degree in accounting or the equivalent combination of education and experience is required • 7+ years of Private Equity Fund accounting experience, including waterfall analysis and specification and/or development strongly preferred • Investran and Cascade proficiency strongly preferred • Waterfall Software strongly preferred • Advanced Excel required; VBA programming a strong plus • Strong analytical and quantitative skills • Ability to read and analyze a Fund Limited Partnership Agreement (“LPA”), the legal document that governs the waterfall calculation strongly preferred • Ability to translate language from LPA to business requirements strongly preferred • Desire and proven ability to master accounting applications strongly preferred • Experience in large systems conversion projects a plus strongly preferred  For over 230 years, the people of BNY Mellon have been at the forefront of finance, expanding the financial markets while supporting investors throughout the investment lifecycle. column2: Senior Representative, Fund/Client Accounting - Night Shift (6PM - 2:30AM)
column4:
Client Service Delivery (CSD) brings together BNY Mellon's key operational areas into one global team to better support the company's businesses and serve clients around the world. CSD helps clients to conduct business, service assets, and engage in transactions in 36 countries and more than 100 markets. At every stage of the investments lifecycle - creating, trading, clearing, settling, holding, servicing, managing, distributing and restructuring assets - CSD is working to make BNY Mellon the recognized industry service quality and productivity leader. Client Service Delivery manages investment monitoring, measurement and processing services for our clients. Our solutions include Securities Operations, Fund Administration, Transfer Agency, Outsourcing, Performance Measurement and other related services.
 
Primarily responsible for the timely preparation and calculation of client net asset values (NAVs) in accordance with BNY Mellon standard operating procedures.  Responsibility is also held for the delivery of ad hoc client service deliveries and assisting with the training/mentoring of Fund Accountants. 

Key responsibilities for night shift 6PM - 2:30AM:
 

Sign-off on daily checklists for all net asset values prepared by you.
Ensuring the NAVs are accurately prepared for Supervisor review and reported within deadlines.
Preparation and calculation of accurate NAVs across all funds.
Adhering to The Bank of New York Mellon standard procedures and controls.
Preparation cash and asset reconciliations for review and sign off by Supervisor.
Performing price tolerance checks.
Reconciliations to Phoenix records.
Communicating any operational issues that arise to Supervisor.
Maintaining daily/monthly files as selected by fund Supervisor in a manner suitable for future review by Supervisor and internal auditors.
Providing non-daily services to all clients as directed by Supervisor.
Ensuring client concerns/requests are addressed as soon as possible and within an agreed timetable.
Keeping Supervisor informed of any issues and their progress and highlighting any client concerns/complaints as a matter of urgency.
Ensuring client specific monthly checklists as allocated by Supervisor are completed according to the agreed timetable for review by Supervisor.
Maintaining a friendly but professional relationship for all dealings with clients.
Being proactive in identifying potential client issues. Qualifications 
University Education: BA or/and MA in finances, economics, accounting, administration, financial markets, management, mathematics etc
Excellent English skills
Up to 1.5 years of professional experience in financial institution
Ability to learn quickly
Good communication skills
Proficient in the use of Windows-based computer applications.
Attention to detail and the ability to work under pressure within set deadlines.
Works well in a team environment and individually.

 Full time contract of employment

The Corporate Actions Accounting Department performs both mandatory and voluntary corporate action related accounting processing functions in over 65 markets for Bank of New York Mellon s clients. The group is responsible for managing and controlling high levels of risk and liability inherent in the various functions. The incumbent is responsible for processing both mandatory and voluntary corporate actions accounting functions related to international and US securities for all Bank of New York Mellon accounts. S/He is responsible for processing basic to moderately intricate corporate action events for multiple markets. This includes the daily interpretation, monitoring, and scrubbing of corporate action events as well as the monitoring and posting of accruals to client accounts. S/he will work on multiple Bank of New York Mellon systems including three different accounting platforms, as well as with vendor products such as Bloomberg and FT Interactive Data, to ensure the correct cost analysis; tax treatment and market impact is reviewed for each corporate action event prior to posting the actual online cash and security transactions for each account. The incumbent is responsible for adhering to established quality control measures and procedures. S/He will interact daily with external vendor support representatives, individual company investor relation contacts, and other internal business groups including Corporate Actions Custody, Service Delivery and Pricing teams. S/he is responsible for understanding market-specific requirements for corporate actions accounting processing.
